loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Map

texts.en: Mrs. Map I., 50, is a widowed woman who resides in a district of Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. She is a good mother who takes care of two school-aged kids, while another one is now married and lives independently. She is jobless and stays at home to do housework and cook. The family is supported by her daughter, who provides small loans wI. specific repayment schedules to people who live nearby. Map I. has a son who doesn’t have a job; she hopes to provide him wI. enough to invest in a taxi business. Because Map I. has no cash yet, she has decided to ask for a loan of $1000, which she will use to buy a motorcycle wI. an attached trailer for her son, so he can begin operating a taxi service. Map I. is hopeful that this loan will lead to a stable income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle with an attached trailer

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of  five members who are located in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mr. Khun C. is a 27-year-old married man and he is the leader of the group who has selected by the members. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mr. Khun C. and his wife, Mrs. Sreypov Voeun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate watermelon. In order to support this farming, Mr. Khun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy watermelon seed and to pay for a farm laborer to support their farm.

This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seed and to pay a farm laborer

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. M. is a 41-year-old married woman. She works very hard as a fish seller, and typically earns around $5 per day. She has a life partner in her husband, who owns a workshop in front of their home where he operates a vehicle repair service. The couple have been married many years, and they have three children. All of them have left school and are employed; two are garment workers and one is a security guard. Mrs. M. will be using her loan to buy a used vehicle for her children to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sreimach's Group

texts.en:
This group loan from Preak Ta Nob village in Kandal province consists of 19 members. Mrs. Sreimach C., a 35-year-old married woman, was selected by the other members as the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sreimach C. and her husband, Mr. Chan Toem, have two children who are students in the local school.  The couple are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. Mrs. Sreimach C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her cucumber crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 30-year-old married lady with two children.  She runs a boutique and a grocery shop to earn a living.   She saves part of her income with a group called Halleluyah.  She is a member of Faulu Kenya, which has trained her in customer care and thus helped improve her business.  She has requested a loan of KES 70,000 to increase her stock of clothes.  She hopes to open up more boutiques to increase her sales in the future.  She also dreams of opening a knitting college.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. S., 49, and her husband, Keut Om, 48 run their business out of their home. They get cloth from the garment industry to sew into other products to sell, typically making US$3 a day to support their family’s daily expenses. They have five children, three of whom work in a garment factory. S. has difficulty delivering the finished clothing to her customers because her motor is too small to carry much. So S. is requesting a loan to buy a trailer to use with her existing motor so she can handle more clothes.

loans.use: To buy a trailer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en: Wilkister is 45 years old and married with five children who are in school. She runs a shop where she offers photocopy and battery-charging services to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has two employees. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save money with her group, named Emmanuel, which enables her to borrow from Faulu. She has requested a loan of kes 75,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a laminating machine and a photocopier. She hopes in the future to open more outlets and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a laminating machine and a photocopier

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon S., 46, is a widow and the mother of two unmarried children. She earns a living as a fish catcher in and around Tunle Sap Lake — a good place to find fish. She usually makes $3 a day to support her family. Suon S. became a Kiva borrower some time ago. She is taking out her second loan to purchase more tools for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for fishing.

loans.name: Jude

texts.en: Jude is a 45-year-old married man who has three children in school.  He has been offering medical services for the past eight years.  He is also employed as a doctor.  He uses his income to pay his three employees and to support his family.  He is a member of Fadhili group which consists of entrepreneurs who meet on weekly basis to save their money and also guarantee each other for loans in Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 75,000 KES to buy medical equipment. He hopes to have a well established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy medical equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell hair extensions and pagnes

loans.name: Viora

texts.en:
Viora is a 32-year-old married lady with one school-age child.  She sells handbags, cloth fabric, dresses and ladies shoes to earn a living. She was previously employed in a hotel.  She has been in this business for two years.  She also does farming so as to meet her family’s needs financially.  

She is a member of the Diamond Women group where all the members are women who have a common goal which is to succeed in business.  Being a member of this group, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to add to her stock of shoes, dresses and handbags.  She sees herself diversifying into the real estate business in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes, cloth fabric, dresses and handbags

loans.name: Leph

texts.en:
Mrs. Leph F. is forty-nine years old and a married mother of six teenage children. Two of her children are employed selling toys for a small firm, while the remaining four are going to school and also help her business when they are free. 

Leph F. is a clothes seller who owns a rental kiosk inside the market for selling her clothes. Also, she gets some money from her husband's fishing business. Leph F. has sold nearly all her clothes to buyers and she wants to resupply her stock. She is applying for a loan to order and purchase clothes for her kiosk.

loans.use: To order and purchase clothes for her kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a 54-year-old father of four. He offers laundry services and has one employee. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He was previously employed before he ventured into business.  

He is a member of a group named Miracle under Faulu Kenya, which consists of his friends who also do business. They meet frequently to catch up on their businesses and save part of their income.  Being a member of the group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya since they co-guarantee each other as a group. He has therefore requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a washing machine.

He hopes to become financially stable in the future. Manuel is a focused man who dreams of operating a chain of laundry shops.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old and married with four children who go to school. She has been running a bakery in Nairobi for five years to earn a living. She bakes her cakes and distributes them locally to retail shops. She was previously selling animal feeds before she ventured into this business. 

She is a member of the Five Star group in Faulu Kenya, which consists of entrepreneurs who are willing and determined to improve their lives. The members of the group meet on a weekly basis to save their money and co-guarantee each other to borrow loans. 

She has requested a loan of 81,700 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy a solar panel. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel

loans.name: Ajayi

texts.en:
Ajayi has a shop where she sells foodstuffs (amala), yam flour, plantain flour, and firewood. Amala in Yoruba land is a special delicacy and a common foodstuff in every home. This business is her livelihood and she has been in the business for over 15 years. She is very happy with the way her business is growing.

Ajayi is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant, and they live in Lagos.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fire wood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prepare and sell cornmeal mush

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is the mother who is blessed with five children. Two are married and have already started new homes, while the other three are single. She has two children who are working as fishermen. 

S., age 48, owns a medium-sized piece of farmland that she plants rice crops on to earn a living. Also, she goes with her husband and her children to fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake for additional income. S. faces a problem: She has no vehicle for traveling. S. has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy a new motorbike to provide transportation for her family. She intends to use any remaining money from the loan to buy fishing tools for fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
N. Sarah’s odds to succeed in her four-year-old water-selling business are in the ascendant, mostly boiling down to her entrepreneurial resourcefulness. She started off from scratch with no piped water within her vicinity in Kireka, Kampala.

Notwithstanding this, 42-year-old Sarah has persisted in making enormous headway in her business. She bought a small water tank. This flood-tide has gotten her to a point where she makes profits to the tune of 100,000 shillings monthly.

Sarah’s good line of business conduct has significantly played into her hands as she now has a niche in her home area. She wants to buy a second water tank with the assistance of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a second water tank

loans.name: Channy Sokh Group

texts.en:
Vat P., Leng K., Chanphall P., Channy S., S. Heng A. and Saei C. all live in Preaek Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. The six members of this lending group are part of AMK’s Loan Workout Program. All clients have outstanding loans that are delinquent and they are currently unable to pay back the full amount of their existing loan. 

Their business ventures, which they funded using their existing loan, have failed, putting them in a very unfortunate position. In addition, less work at garment factories and sickness in their families have drastically reduced other sources of income for each family. All six clients will use their loan to start a new business making T-shirts.

As part of AMK’s workout program, each client is given a workout loan that will be used to purchase sewing machines, an electricity line and additional sewing equipment. AMK has hired a tailor to train the group to make T-shirts. The material will be provided by AMK to ensure that quality material is used and so that the clients do not have to purchase it themselves. 

AMK has partnered with Ahkun.org to sell their T-shirts online. Fifty percent of all profits will go to this group and the other borrowers in their village who are unable to repay their loan.

This program is in contrast to the traditional ways that microfinance institutions deal with delinquent clients:
•	By rescheduling the loan and pushing off the problem to another day
•	Repossessing items that the clients own, including their house or land.

Because of AMK’s strong social mission, AMK has created this program to provide an alternative solution to one of microfinance’s dark sides. We hope that Kiva Lenders will support us in this initiative.

All six clients of this group have had previous loans on Kiva:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/58345
http://www.kiva.org/lend/58347
http://www.kiva.org/lend/62359
http://www.kiva.org/lend/63814
http://www.kiva.org/lend/71201
http://www.kiva.org/lend/51660

loans.use: to start a new business making T-shirts

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur fait des activités de restauration. Ses plats sont très appréciés de ses clients, il fait  son commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Faisant face à une rupture de stock des produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 3 sacs de riz, 3 cartons de spaghetti et divers. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants. C’est son activité qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been in the restaurant business for over ten years. His food preparations are much appreciated by his customers. Facing a shortage of supplies needed for his restaurant, he is requesting a loan from WAGES for three bags of rice, 3 cartons of spaghetti and various items. He is married and the father of three children. His activity enables him to take care of his family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and cartons of spaghetti

loans.name: Patience

texts.fr: Cette dame est une femme mariée qui vit dans le quartier de bè kpéhénou avec son époux et ses 4 enfants. Son mari est un agent de santé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales et de tubercules. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 7 sacs de maïs, 2 Sacs d’ignames, et divers.
texts.en:
This lady is married and lives in the Bè Kpéhénou borough with her husband and four children. Her husband is a health worker. Her revenue-generating activity is the trade of grain cereals and tuber roots. She has been in business since 2006 and gets her supplies from the country’s interior. Needing to resupply, she is requesting a loan from WAGES so she can buy seven bags of corn, two bags of cassava, and various other items.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, cassava and various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build more classes for a school

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en: Hezron is 47 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. He makes a living as a farmer and also helps his wife, who is an accountant, provide accounting services. He is a member of Faulu Kenya and a loan group named Ujamaa. This makes it easy for him to get loans because the other members of this group help ensure that he will pay. He appreciates the help he gets from Faulu Kenya, particularly to open an office for his accounting business. He has applied for a loan of Kes.65,000 to buy a motorbike to transport his produce to market. He hopes to expand the market for his goods and someday have a well-established business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: S. is 41-year-old widow who lives in Battambong Province. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She was married at one time, but later divorced her husband when her children were still young. S. makes a living running a beauty salon in her house. She has a lot of customers because she is friendly and helpful. Her business is very profitable and provides enough of an income to support her family. She would like to build a new house but does not have enough money to get started. To make her dream possible, she has applied for a loan to buy materials to start building the house.

loans.use: To buy materials to start building a new house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 33 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She makes a living running a pharmacy and a cosmetic shop. She also rents her house to earn extra income. She has been in business for four years and has one employee. Josephine has joined a group in Faulu Kenya named Elians, whose members co-guarantee each other's loans. She has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to buy additional drugs and cosmetics to sell. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Ta buy additional drugs and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Oluwageniga

texts.en:
Oluwageniga is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria.

Oluwageniga sells medicine. He has been in this business for over 10 years and with LAPO microfinance for 2 years. Oluwageniga is requesting a loan of N70,000. With the loan, he plans to expand his medicine business, which is now booming. With this kind of business, he hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for his children's education.

Oluwageniga says thanks to all Kiva lender for their support and assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 28 years old. She sews clothes in different styles, and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials to schools, individuals, and families based on their orders.

Rosemary currently owns two sewing machines, but with her Kiva loan and her savings, she hopes to purchase one more sewing machine. Since she employs more people to perform sewing, this will vastly improve her business in the future.

Rosemary wants to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to buy one sewing machine and more sarongs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 43-year-old married man and father of 2 school-aged children. He has more than 22 years of experience as a home electrician. He works for individuals and also does some projects for businesses.  Today, Georges is requesting to borrow $1,000 because he's planning to expand his business and needs to buy new electric tools. He hopes that with the help of the loan, his business productivity and income will increase and that this will improve life for his family.  He feels positive about the future of his business and certain that he will be able to take on more and bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy new electric tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improving her garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has run a tailoring business from her home since 2008.  She also works at an environmentA. company in her town to earn extra money to help her husband support the household. She offers all types of sewing services to her clients.

Today, Amira is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an additionA. sewing machine and to expand her home business because she's planning to leave the outside job to focus full-time on the tailoring business. She specifically notes that with the new machine she will be able to deliver her services faster.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 29-year-old single man.  He has been doing gas welding for five years and has two employees.  He also runs a grocery shop to help increase his earnings.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they provide which has helped him develop good management skills.  He hopes to grow his business and stabilize his income in the future.  He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy gas pipes, a dust coat, a welding torch and an acetylene gauge.

loans.use: To buy welding equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna sells textbooks and notebooks at retail in her shop. The shop is very small, but she hopes to expand the business by buying more books to sell at wholesale and retail if she is able to rent a bigger shop in future. She has been in the business for some years now. She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to buy more textbooks and notebooks to sell, as this will attract more customers and maximize her profit.

Anna is 39 years old and married with 5 children; they live together in Lagos. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Charif

texts.en:
Charif is a 58-year-old married man with two dependent children. When he graduated from university 38 years ago, he started giving private lessons to the children in his town and its surroundings. In addition, he's also talented and writes poems. He’s a very brilliant man who likes his job a lot and he feels that he is blessed to have such talent. 

Today, Charif is asking to borrow $1,000 to be able to print his poems in a special poetry book in his name. It will present the collection of his written work over the years and he's very excited to publish it with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Print his poems in a special poetry book

loans.name: Robatina

texts.en:
Robatina is a 28-year-old single lady. She has been running a hair salon for three years. She also earns extra income from her food kiosk. She uses part of her income to pay her two employees.  

She is a member of Faulu Kenya with the Machakos Mwangaza group, where she saves her money. Being a member of the group, she has an advantage because she can get a loan from Faulu Kenya since the members are her guarantors.  

She plans to take a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more plastic chairs for her salon and a hair blow dryer. She hopes to cut the cost of renting a business premises by buying a plot of land to build her business. She dreams of expanding the business and employing more people.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and a hair blow dryer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 47 years old. He is married and has two children, who are in school. He runs a taxi business in Nairobi to earn a living. John has twenty years of experience in this business. He was previously employed as a mechanic, before starting his taxi business. He has requested for a loan of KES 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to repair his vehicle and to add another car. He plans to run a car hire business in ten years time. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle and add another car for his business

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en: Janeffer is a 35-year-old married lady with two children in school. Her husband is a salesperson while she raises poultry to earn a living. She has been a member of Faulu Kenya with the group "Amahesa Women". Her business has expanded since she joined Faulu Kenya and her standard of living has improved. This is because she previously took out a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from the organization with the group members as guarantors. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicks, chicken feed and medicine for her broilers. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and medicine for broilers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Janety

texts.en: Janety is 47 years old and married with three children. She runs a tailoring shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Her husband is employed as a marketer and therefore he earns a salary which he uses to support his family. Janety also earns extra income from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya in a group named Hera Kajiado, her business has expanded because she can access loans. She saves her money with her group members. She is unable to meet all her customers’ demands due to limited stock; hence, she has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy cloth fabric. She dreams of running a dressmaking college in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of cloth fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rouhiya

texts.en: Rouhiya, who has 18 years of experience as a beautician, is a single woman living with her mother and sister. In order to help with her family’s expenses, Rouhiya has opened a beauty salon in her town. With the $1,000 loan she has requested, she plans to expand her business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment. Rouhiya says that her business productivity and income will both increase as a result of this loan because it will satisfy the needs of her business development in addition to attracting more and new clients.

loans.use: To add new services and purchase more equipment

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d'AKPAN qui est une nourriture très appréciée dans la cuisine togolaise et faite à base de céréales, une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour l’achat de 5 sacs de maïs, des sacs de mil, des sacs de sorgho et autres.
Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle contribue avec son revenu aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
Ms Kokoe G., a married woman and mother of five children, is involved in the activity of selling AKPAN, which is a food made from a variety of grains/cereals that is very appreciated in Togolese culture. As part of her stock is now depleted, she is soliciting a loan to use in re-stocking her ingredients. She would like to purchase five bags of corn, bags of millet, bags of sorghum and others. She uses the profits from her business to support the family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing grains

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a contractor who offers complete renovation and reconstruction services in his region. He is a businessman from Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. Vasyl is married with two sons. He has an employed team of different workers who can handle various exterior and interior repair issues. He has been in business for 5 years. The high quality of his services has been the main factor that has impacted rapid development of his business. Presently, Vasyl has about 10,000 grivnyas worth of inventory. His gross income amounts to 7,000 grivnyas a month.

Vasyl is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnyas to purchase materials and equipment to do remodeling in some facilities in his region. He is hoping to take on several renovation projects thus ensuring consistent pay for his employees. Vasyl is a hard worker. He is a demanding employer but this helps him keep a good and solid standing among other competitors working in the same sphere of business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy noodles and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is 28 years of age and married with 2 children. Her husband is a business man and they live together in Lagos.

Ada sells electrical goods and building materials in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. With the little profit she earns from her business, she helps her husband take care of their family.

Ada is determined to pull her family out of poverty. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more electrical goods and building materials to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods and building materials to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina sells women’s clothing outfits in the local mall called Tsentralnyi (Central). Marina is married with children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in the town of Novaya Kahovka. She was forced to launch her business 17 years ago in the volatile perestroika times to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Currently, Marina has 70,000 grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover capital is about 20,000 grivnyas. Monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 grivnyas. Marina is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to diversify clothing merchandise in her mall outlet. She believes the current loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase selection of merchandise for the coming summer season. Marina realizes that at all stages in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to keep a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: To diversify assorted merchandise

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
If you subsist on agriculture like N. Annet has found out, you need enormous reserves of patience to succeed. That particular attribute has manifestly worked in N.’s favor. She is a living testament to this. She speaks with pride of how her seven children are now all attaining an education in high institutions of learning.

N.’s proficiency in attending to her banana gardens for the last thirty years in Kakungu, Ntungamo, has borne her fruits. In a month, she makes profits to the tune of 300,000 UGX. The only major drawn out problem that has plagued her business has been the persistent low banana market prices.

It’s N.’s reckoning that this loan will come in handy in helping her enhance her banana plantations through mulching and the buying of fertilizer.

loans.use: To enhance her banana plantations through mulching and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase frozen foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow. She has raised her 19-year-old daughter, Alina, herself. Natalya is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, where she runs a water-filter sales venture in one of the local malls. She started this business only one year ago. Currently, her working capital amounts to 20,000 Grivnyas and her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Natalya is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase her working capital and assorted merchandise for further retail sale. She is hoping to generate additional profit and invest it in reconstruction of her small vending facility. Natalya is a competent expert, which has helped her gain the trust of her customers. Water filters sell well in Berdyansk as running water is polluted and needs additional purification. Natalya enjoys working with this type of merchandise and is hoping to continue growing her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing directly from the company at a reduced rate

loans.name: Kilda

texts.en: Kilda is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been running a tailoring business from her home as a support income for her family. She has been involved in this occupation for the past 20 years. She produces all types of clothes. After this long period working at the same sewing machine, it became very used and old and it became hard to work on it. So it takes big time to deliver her products. That’s why she wants to borrow $1,000 to buy a new developed sewing machine to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Galiya

texts.en:
Galiya is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov selling fruit, vegetables, baked goods, sweets, groceries, drinks, etc. in her little store. Her store is located right next to a big parking lot, which makes it a very favorable location and a popular stop for potential customers. Galiya has been working in this trade for nine years. Presently, she has 14,000 grivnyas in inventory.

Galiya is requesting a 10,000-grivnya loan to purchase a tractor. She and her husband own a big lot where they grow some farm produce. Galiya is hoping to use the tractor to plow the soil and grow more vegetables. Then they can sell their own agricultural produce in their little store instead of buying it from other farmers for further re-sale. Galiya’s daughter is actively helping her with this small venture. Galiya is hoping to see her daughter inherit their small family business some day.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 35-year-old single man. He runs a retail shop where he sells clothes and shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for ten years and has one employee.  He has been saving his money with his group in Faulu Kenya. The group, named Tumaini Springs, guarantees loans to its members.  He has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to add more clothes and shoes for sale and to open an outlet.  He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale one in the future.

(The photo has been taken away from his business.)

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes and to open an outlet

loans.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es:
“Alaxpacha”  es un grupo de 8 señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada”,  este es su segundo ciclo y se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de deportivos, jugos, artesanía de caretas de santos, producción de calzados ,confección de ropa de bebe y carnicería.
Un ejemplo claro es Cristina Gregorio P. de 42 años casada, hace un tiempo atrás, con trabajo y esfuerzo  logro instalar en su domicilio una tienda de venta de carne, mejor conocida como  “carnicería”, ella vende todos los días y tiene clientes frecuentes. Cristina necesita el préstamo para comprar su producto “carne”.
texts.en:
Alaxpacha is a group of eight women who have their meetings in the “Villa Focal” regional office of Pro Mujer. This is their second loan cycle, and they got together recently to approve this loan, as all of them need to increase their working capital. The members of Alaxpacha have various businesses such as sales of sports wear, juices, handmade masks of saints, shoemaking, making of baby clothes, and meat sales. An example is Cristina Gregorio P., 42. Some time ago, with much work and effort, she managed to put a meat sales business in her house. She sells every day and has regular customers. She needs this loan to buy meat to sell.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 29 years old and married with one child who is in school. She runs a clinic where she conducts tests to earn a living.  She also earns extra income from selling milk and eggs. Her husband is a businessman. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has benefited by saving her money with her group members(named Five Star), enabling her to access loans because the members are her guarantors. She dreams of opening a hospital in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more medical clinic equipment.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en:
Nadim is a 45-year-old married man with three school-age children. He runs a successful van taxi business and he has over 15 years of experience as a taxi driver. In Lebanon, it is common to use taxi services to go between neighborhoods in a given town as well as to travel between different regions. These services are especially important in areas where the infrastructure is less developed, which is true for most of the towns outside of Beirut and its surrounding suburbs. 

Today, Nadim is asking to borrow $1,200 to perform much needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body to offer comfortable transportation service to his customers.

loans.use: To perform maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nkeiruka

texts.en:
Nkeiruka sells foodstuffs like garri (cassava flakes), rice, beans and yam flour. She buys in large quantities and sells retail. She is very hardworking as she has to leave home as early as 5 a.m. to be able get goods to buy.

Nkeiruka has been in business for three years and with this supports her husband in providing for the family. She is 23 years old, is married, and has two children. She makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work.

Nkeiruka is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a discount. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married with six children who go to school. He has been running a laundry shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by saving his money with his fellow members of the Pendano group. He can easily be guaranteed with the members if he takes a loan. He had previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, which he used to expand his business and successfully repaid. He hopes to grow his business and open outlets with modern equipment.  

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy washing detergents, an iron box, a water tank and a generator.

loans.use: To buy detergents, an iron box, water tanks and a generator

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 42 years old and married with two children. He runs a transportation business to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He says that the business is good because people prefer motorcycles since they are a fast means of transportation. 

He has been saving his money with his group members, who guarantee loans for their members. He has previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and which he successfully repaid. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
S. is a fifty-three-year-old married man and father of three children, two of whom are employed and help him in the household. He has been working as a farmer since 1997. His village is known as an agriculture village, and the majority of the villagers work in this sector. He learned this occupation from his father. He cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season and he distributes his harvest to a variety of markets in the village. 

Today, S. is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a plow to cultivate his land for the coming summer season.

loans.use: To purchase a plow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Omran

texts.en: Omran is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with one young child. He opened a blacksmith shop in 2008 and has nine years of experience in this occupation. He is the only provider for his family, and his business is his source of income. He works hard to satisfy the needs of his baby. He has a great demand for his shop, and he wants to buy more tools in order to be able to do the work his clients request. He wants to take out a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools and enlarge his shop to meet his clients' requirements and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 21-year-old married man.  He has been running a cafeteria for six years and has one employee.  He also earns extra income from his rental houses. He was previously working in a video library.  He is a member of Faulu Kenya in a group named Mlajasho where the group members meet frequently to share business ideas and save money.  For this reason, he can easily take a loan because his group members are his guarantors.  He plans to take out a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a cooker and open another cafeteria.  He hopes to expand his business into a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cooker and open up another cafeteria

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a thirty-seven-year-old married lady. To earn a living, she sells charcoal to people who live near her home. She has been in this business for five years. She says that her business turnover is high because charcoal is the cheapest cooking fuel in the area. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has expanded because she can access loans. She saves her money with a group under Faulu Kenya named Winners, which enables her to access loans because the members guarantee each other. She has limited stock and yet high demand, therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan trabaja en la prefectura del Departamento de La Paz a contrato, ya es independiente, y trabaja para solventar los gastos de estudios, de alimentación y vestimenta.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Central de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para educación (compra de una computadora, que lo utilizará para sus estudios en la universidad).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones de estudios..
texts.en:
Ivan has a contract working in the prefecture of the La Paz department. He is independent, and he works to pay for his educational expenses, his food, and his clothing. He lives in his grandparents’ house in the Central region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for his education (to buy a computer to use for his university studies). This is the third time he has asked Impro for a loan. With this loan he will be able to improve his educational circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer to continue his studies at the Accounting Institue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David trabaja como mensajero en una oficina, actualmente estudia contabilidad y es el único que solventa todos sus gastos ya que es independiente.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Chasquipampa de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital educación (pago de matricula e inscripciones en su instituto de contabilidad ).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales.
texts.en:
David works as an office messenger. He is currently studying accounting, and he is the only one who pays all of his expenses because he is independent. He lives in his parents’ house in the Chasquipampa region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for his education (pay for enrollment and registration in the Institute of Accounting). This is the second time he has asked Impro for a loan. With this loan he will be able to improve his working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for enrollment and registration in the Institute of Accounting that he attends

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es transportista inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto; trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, tiene su taxi que trabaja de trufi, es su principal fuente de trabajo con que cubre la manutención de su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres sin pagar alquiler en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación de sus herramienta de trabajo (compra de llantas y amortiguadores)  de esa forma seguirá trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos familiares.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación de otro préstamo para Juan.
texts.en:
Juan is a taxi driver on the inter-city line between El Alto and La Paz. He works as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa labor union. He has a taxi that works as a minibus, and it is his principal source of employment. With his taxi earnings, he is able to support his wife and two small sons, ages 6 and 2. He lives rent-free in his parents house in July 16 zone of El Alto. The loan he requests will go towards the repair of his instrument of work, specifically to purchase new tires and shock absorbers. By replacing these parts, he will be able to continue covering his family's expenses through his taxi service earnings. This is Juan's second loan with IMPRO. His record of responsible behavior and proper repayment permits his approval for an additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de llantas y amortiguadores para su taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and ties to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es artesano; confecciona chamarras al por mayor; estudia en la universidad estatal UPEA la carrera de ciencia de la educación. La confección de chamarras es su principal fuente de ingresos con que cubre sus gastos personales y su educación. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Ciudad Villa Tunari – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de  materia prima (tela) para poder incrementar su producción y poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Nestor.
texts.en:
Nestor is a craftsman; he makes jackets that are sold at wholesale. He is a student at the state university UPEA, and is majoring in educational sciences. The production of jackets is his main source of income with which he covers his personal and educational expenses. He lives in his parents' home located in the Ciudad Villa Tunari-Rio Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials (fabric) so that he can increase his production and satisfy the demand that exists in his market. This is his first loan with IMPRO. Nestor was approved for this loan after a credit evaluation conducted by IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is widowed and a mother of one. She rears chicken on her farm to earn a living. She sells eggs, chickens and chicks to her neighbors and friends who know about her business. She also runs a retail shop to earn enough money to support her family since she is the breadwinner.

She has been saving her money with her group in Faulu Kenya named Kasa Self Group. The group guarantees loans for its members. She has previously taken out and successfully repaid three loans from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to expand her business. She has requested a loan for 60,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to grow her business to a wholesale outlet in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Avanzando Contigo Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Avanzando Contigo” y se conforma por 16 socias pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa usada, ropa interior, comida según la época del año (por ejemplo humitas), repostería y coctelería, atención de centro de Internet, zapatería y bordados.
La socia entrevistada fue Esperanza, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, agachada, tiene el pelo hasta los hombros. Ella tiene una rotisería (donde se venden alimentos perecibles y no perecibles) en su casa. Con el crédito quiere ampliar su negocio, ya que su sueño es tener un minimarket, que cuente con una gran variedad de productos, no solo alimentos, sino que también artículos de librería. Para lograrlo quiere ir incorporando de a poco productos nuevos, por ejemplo su próxima meta es comprar una fotocopiadora. 
Además tiene otras metas personales como sacar su 4º año de educación media, lo cual está realizando este año en jornada vespertina, para así más adelante estudiar una carrera. Su mayor sueño es ser fuente de trabajo para otras personas como ella, con ganas de superarse. Su gran motivación es su familia, sus dos hijas, de 11 y 2 años y su esposo que la apoya en todo.
Esperanza siente que Fondo Esperanza significa un pilar muy importante para su desarrollo personal y estabilidad económica y está muy agradecida de la facilidad con la cual ha obtenido sus créditos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Avanzando Contigo" is made up of 16 members from the city of Temuco. They work mainly in the area of retail sales, including sales of used clothing, underwear, food according to the season of the year (for example, tamales), and catering. Other members also attend to an internet cafe, make and repair shoes, and do embroidery. The member interviewed was Esperanza, who is the president of this group. In the photograph she is found in the first row, crouching, with shoulder-length hair. She has a deli (where she sells perishable and non-perishable food) in her house. With the loan she wants to expand her business, since her dream is eventually have a mini-market where she can sell a large variety of products, including not only food but also office supplies. To achieve this she wants to start gradually incorporating new products into her business. For example, her next goal is to buy a photocopier. In addition, she has other personal goals such as completing her last year of high school, which she is doing this year in the evenings, so that later on she can begin to study for an advanced degree. Her main dream is to be a source of work for others like her who want to succeed. Her greatest motivation is her family: her 2 daughters, aged 11 and 2, and her husband who supports her in everything. Esperanza feels that the Fondo Esperanza supports her personal development and economic stability, and she is very grateful for the easy terms at which she has been able to access credit. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), and has number of lake resorts and colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth highlighting that this region is where 50 percent of Chile's Mapuches (indigenous people) live.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her business (construction)

loans.name: Camino Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Camino al Triunfo” y está conformado por 13 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente a la preparación y venta de alimentos como sopaipillas, mote con huesillos, hot dogs, empanadas, churrascos, almuerzos y desayunos preparados, almacén, minimarket, fotocopias y venta de muebles.
La socia entrevistada fue Damaris, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en el 4º asiento de izquierda a derecha en la 1º fila. Ella tiene un minimercado en su misma casa y es una herencia de su mamá. 
Damaris invertirá este préstamo en comprar mercadería y apartará lo que le falta para hacerle un cobertizo a su negocio, para de esta manera prepararse para la lluvia del invierno. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y poder algún día entregarlo como  herencia a sus hijas. Tiene 2 hijas, una estudiando en 4º año medio y la mayor que le ayuda en el negocio. 
Lo que más le gusta a Damaris de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es conocer a más personas emprendedoras igual que ella, ya que así aprende de las experiencias de sus compañeros y se pueden aconsejar mutuamente. Además comenta que le ha servido mucho la educación sobre el manejo del dinero en el negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This bank is called “Camino al Futuro" (Path to the Future) and is comprised of 13 members from the city of Temuco. They primarily work in making food like “sopaipillas” (a type of fried pastry), “mote con huesillos” (a traditional Chilean summer-time drink), hot dogs, empanadas, barbecued beef, and prepared breakfasts and lunches. Some members have grocery stores, mini-markets, provide photocopies, or sell furniture. Damaris is the member that was interviewed. She is the secretary of the group. In the photo she is in the fourth seat from left to right in the first row. She has a mini-market, which she inherited from her mother, in her house. Damaris will use the loan to buy merchandise. She will put aside what she needs to make a shelter for her business. That way she will be prepared for the winter rains. Her dream is to expand her business to be able to someday give it as an inheritance to her daughters. She has two daughters. One is in her fourth year of high school, and the older one helps with the business. What Damaris likes the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is meeting more entrepreneurial people who are like her. That way she learns from her colleagues' experiences, and they can give each other advice. She also says that the education about managing money in business has helped her a lot. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). It has a series of marshy spas and very colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth stating that 50% of the mapuches, indigenous people, that exist in our country are living in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beer, drinks, and some of the loan for a shelter from the rains

loans.name: Sergio Abelardo

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio, es un cliente  que trabaja con crédito en Emprender desde el año 2006,, se encuentra en su sexta secuencia, él trabaja de día en una Empresa constructora por las lomas de Achumani, realizando sevicio de transporte, llevando material y otros artículos que la empresa solicita, recibiendo un salario quincenal de aproximadamente  por la noche trabaja en su taxi que esta afiliado a taxi trufi 1, Sergio esta casado, su esposa trabaja también en dicha empresa de construcción como control del personal, ambos son personas jóvenes y tienen un hijo pequeño que lo dejan al cuidado de su abuela paterna.los créditos que saca de la Institución son generalmente pequeños y para mantención del transporte, como en esta secuencia él solicito un credito para la renovacion de su licencia de conducir y tambien para la compra de llantas, ellos viven por la zona de Chasquipampa en la casa de la mamá de Sergio. En estos años el respondió con responsabilidad los pagos de sus créditos y esperamos que en este crédito trabaje de la misma manera. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio is a client who has been working with Emprender since 2006. He is currently in his sixth loan cycle. During the day, Sergio works for a construction company in the hills of Achumani. He is responsible for transporting materials and other items that his company has requested. Sergio receives a salary every two weeks and works just about every night driving a “trufi” (a taxi that travels a set destination) along Route #1. His wife also works for the same construction company in human resources. Both of them are young and have a small child who is looked after by Sergio’s mother.

The loans he receives from Emprender are generally small and used for vehicle maintenance. For this loan cycle, the funds he requested will be used to pay for his driver’s license renewal as well as purchase tires. Sergio and his family live at his mother’s house in the Chasquipampa district. Over the years, he has handled his payments responsibly and expects to do the same with this loan. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & pay for his driver's license renewal

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 43 years old and married with two children. He is a self-employed professional veterinarian.  He has been in this business for 11 years and his customers are livestock farmers. He also rears cattle for beef to earn extra income. His wife is also a farmer and together they rear cattle to earn enough money to support their family.   

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has saved his money in his group named Gathaithi Tuinuane, which enables him to access loans. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add stock of veterinary drugs and to buy a motorbike and a heifer. He hopes to increase his turnover after buying a motorbike since he can then reach more customers.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs, a motorbike and a heifer

loans.name: Farma

texts.fr:
Farma D. est une femme âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de développer des activités multiples telles que la vente de céréales, de beignets, de sucre et de bétail.

Ces activités lui procurent des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Farma D. is a 46 year old woman and mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Community Bank DANKH SENE for the last seven and a half years and has received 15 loans during this time period. She is asking for a new loan in order to develop several retail activities such as the sale of cereals/grains, doughnuts, sugar and livestock. Profits from the sale of these activities would be used toward improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her retail activities

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio G. tiene un taller en donde elabora todo tipo de Sandalias, el tiene tres hijos menores que están en edad escolar y su esposa, el les provee con la ganancia de su negocio el sustento diario a su familia. Él se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para la compra de tiras de baquetas que es el material con el que elabora sus sandalias y así suplir las necesidades que tienen sus clientes y poder tener un poco más de utilidades y darle un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia, además de que con la ganancia del primer crédito le hizo mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
El señor Oscar Antonio G. tiene un taller en donde elabora todo tipo de Sandalias, el tiene tres hijos menores que están en edad escolar y su esposa, el les provee con la ganancia de su negocio el sustento diario a su familia. Él se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para la compra de tiras de baquetas que es el material con el que elabora sus sandalias y así suplir las necesidades que tienen sus clientes y poder tener un poco más de utilidades y darle un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia, además de que con la ganancia del primer crédito le hizo mejoras a su casa.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de tiras de baquetas.

loans.name: Neida

texts.es: La Sra. Neida es madre soltera y tiene una hija que se encuentra en la Universidad, ella tiene la actividad de una tienda bien surtida de Regalos juegos de mesa la cual es muy conocida en su barrio por los diferentes , llamativos productos que ofrece y a muy bajo costo por ese motivo siempre tiene mucha clientela , la Sra es dueña de casa cuenta su hija siempre la esta apoyando en el negocio y tambien se da tiempo para sus estudios, el deseo de la Sra. Neida es de ver a su hija profesional y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Neida is a single mother with a daughter attending university. She manages a store that is well-stocked with gifts and board games. Neida’s business is widely known in the neighborhood for offering different products at low prices, which is the reason why she has always had many customers. Her daughter has always helped her with the business, but now she also devotes time to her studies. Sra. Neida desires to see her daughter become a professional so that she can improve the quality of life for her own family.

She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Alejandro Ramón

texts.es: El señor Alejandro Ramón A. D. es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Operario de limpieza, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, pero solo uno depende de el los demás viven con el pero trabajan por cuenta propia, su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega es operaria de limpieza ambos luchan por mantener un trabajo digno y darle lo mejora a sus hijos por eso se ayudan con el financiamiento de CEPRODEL  para ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alejandro Ramón works as a custodian in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and has four children, but only one still depends on him for support. The others live with him, but work and support themselves. His wife also works for the city call as a cleaning woman. Both strive to maintain dignified employment and provide a better life for their children. They have requested this loan trough CEPRODEL in order to be able to make improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Alina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Alina Isabel S. V. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeña el cargo de Secretaria es madre soltera de dos hijos  en edad escolar vive en el reparto Corazón de Jesús y vive junto con sus padres.

La señora Alina S. lleva ya  cuatro años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Alina works as a secretary at the Chinandega city hall. She is a single mother with two school-aged children. She lives with her parents in the Corazón de Jesús area. Alina has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and she has proven herself to be very responsible with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro trabaja como albañil; la esposa es artesana y teje aguayos de lana, mismo que son comercializados en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto (aguayos son mantas que tienen varios usos, como ser manteles, o pequeñas camas, etc.); Estas dos actividades generan sus ingresos principales con los que cubre la manutención de su familia, que consiste en dos hijos.

Vive en casa ubicado en la zona Ciudad Villa Tunari – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  material de construcción (estuco, pinturas) con lo que podrá comenzar a trabajar en la obra fina de su casa.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Teodoro.
texts.en:
Teordoro works as a bricklayer. His wife is an artisan, and she weaves “aguayos” from wool. ("Aguayos" are blankets that have various uses such as tablecloths or small beds, etc.) They are sold in the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. These two activities generate their primary income, which covers supporting their family. They have two children. He lives in a house located in the Villa Tunari – Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction material (stucco, paints) so that he will be able to start the finishing work on his house. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Teodoro for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stucco and paints to start the finishing work on his house

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Muvule crescent,a business location in Jinja has quite an extraordinary pedigree when it comes to lucrative business franchises. There is a story connected with doing business in that neighborhood. It is a story of roaring trade deals.

Not to be left out of this opportunity is a certain 45-year-old hardworking retailer by the name of W. Dominic. This father of seven school-going children operates a thriving ten-year-old retail shop in Bufubuli, Muvule crescent. Since his business took root, he has steadily been making ends meet and earning profits. In a month, he reveals he makes 60,000 shillings. He also has another source of income he relies on that is selling sugarcane.

With this loan Dominic is highly optimistic that his business will make headway. He hopes to buy more merchandise for his shop.

Dominic W. appears at the left of the photo and in the Photo is also the Credit Officer responsible for him.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his retail shop

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María C. es casada de profesión profesora de primaria actualmente se desempeña como directora del colegio Efraín Tijerino Mazariego, vive en la colonia Roberto Gonzales tiene dos hijos estudian en secundaria.

La señora Ana María C. tiene cinco de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para construir su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María C. is married and a primary school teacher by profession. Currently she is working as the director of the Efraín Tijerino Mazariego school. She lives in the Roberto Gonzales neighborhood with her two children who are in high school. Mrs. Ana María C. has been working with CEPRODEL for the last five years. Her last loan was used to build her home and give her family more security.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (zinc, roofing timbers, nails, cement, and, and labor)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to cook and sell

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
La joven Arely Sugey C. P., se dedica a la venta de sopa de res, mondongo, cuajada y de gallina  los días lunes, miércoles, Viernes. En su casa de habitación, barrio san Agustín. 

La joven Arelys C. es madre soltera tiene un hijo de dos años vive con su mama y dos hermanos, tiene tres años de trabajar con créditos los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona honesta y responsable, cabe señalar que con tosodos los créditos obtenidos ha ido mejorando su estilo de vida mejorando su vivienda y manteniendo su negocio.
texts.en:
The young Arely dedicates herself to preparing and selling soups made with beef, tripe, curd, and chicken, on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, from her home in San Agustín barrio. Arely is a single mother who has a 2-year-old son and lives with her mother and two brothers. She has worked for the last 3 years with loans she has paid off as scheduled, demonstrating herself to be an honest and responsible person. It is worthy of mention that with each of the loans she obtained, she has improved her style of life and maintained her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE THE SOUP SHE SELLS

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Wlly vive en la zona  Mariscal Sucre en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus  hijos, en el domicilio propiedad de sus padres.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de un minibús en una línea de transporte publico, en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Willy lives in the Mariscal Sucre neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children in a house that his parents own. He makes a living as an owner-driver on a public bus route in the center of the city. He will use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle. This is his second Impro loan for which he qualified after an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for transportation business.

loans.name: Roberto Julio

texts.es: Don Roberto de 32 años de edad, padre de familia de un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como ingeniera agrícola, y ambos están logrando hacer su casa. Ya tiene parte de la casa avanzada lo cual es un gran logro de alegría para ambos ya que obtendrán un techo digno para su  hijo como mejor privacidad. Don Roberto trabaja como contador desde  hace varios años el cual es su medio de fuente. Con este préstamo quiere comprar zinc, perlines, golosos, puertas que le hacia falta para terminar la casa en poco tiempo y poder mudarse. Sus planes es seguir laborando y ahorrando para seguir con la construcción de las mejoras.
texts.en:
Don Roberto, 32, is the father of a 2 year old son. His wife works as an agricultural engineer and they are working together to build a house. Part of the house is now complete, a source of great pleasure for both of them because it will provide a decent place for their son to live and more privacy. Don Roberto has worked as an accountant for several years and the work is his main source of income. With the loan, he wants to buy roofing materials and other supplies that he needs to finish the house so that the family can move in. His plan for the future is to go on working and saving so that he can continue making improvements to the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for house construction.

loans.name: Bernardo Renee

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo Renee D. Díaz es soltera, tiene dos hijos ninguno a su cargo vive en el barrio el calvario junto a su familia, es trabajador de la alcaldía hace 5 años desempeñándose como Jefe de Seguridad general.
El señor Bernardo D. tiene un año y medio de trabajar con créditos demostrando ser una persona honesta y responsable en cuanto a obligaciones. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar materiales personales y medicina.
texts.en:
Bernardo Renee Delgao Díaz is single and has two children, neither of whom is under his care. He lives with his family in the El Calvario neighborhood. He has been working at City Hall as Security Chief for five years. Bernardo has been receiving loans for a year and a half, showing himself to be a person of honesty and responsibility with respect to his payments. He plans to use this loan to buy personal items and medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy personal items for his home.

loans.name: Solomon Tb Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Paul is also married and the father of five children from age 1-13 who are pursuing education at the primary school level. He is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of his family. He is married to a trader and together they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Paul operates a cold store and sells assorted fish. Fish is a common and important protein source in the preparation of most meals and lot of people prefer fish to meat. He buys assorted fish from fish mongers in fishing areas, freezes them and sells them to households and food vendors in his community. He has operated this business for the past 2 years. 

Paul is currently the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Solomon’ and comprised of six members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish

loans.name: María Confesora

texts.es:
María Confesora tiene 68 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Nueva Arica, un distrito con geografía bastante accidentada debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país, su principal actividad es la agricultura, aunque cuentan con pocas áreas fértiles, se encuentra situado a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María se dedica desD. hace 30 años a vender productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que su negocio nació D. la necesidad D. agenciarse D. un ingreso con el cual sacar adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo pocos productos y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo, su negocio ha crecido y cuenta con una clientela fija que acuD. siempre a consumir sus productos.

Ella compra productos D. primera necesidad en la ciudad D. Chiclayo y trata siempre D. ofrecer productos frescos (verduras, frutas) a sus clientes, su negocio es uno D. los mas surtidos en la zona por lo que es D. mucha ayuda para la comunidad, el distrito D. Nueva Arica es una comunidad con pocos habitantes (14 habitantes por Km2).

María Confesora desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. productos frescos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad con los cuales lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer honrada y trabajadora, ella es muy estimada en la zona donD. vive, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer D. confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Confesora, 68, lives with her family in Nueva Arica, a hilly region at the foot of the mountains of northern Peru. Her main source of income is farming, even though the area is not especially fertile. The city of Chiclayo is an hour and a half away. Maria has operated a grocery, selling everyday commodities, for 30 years. She runs the grocery out of her house. She tells us that she started the business because she needed a way to generate an income for her family. She only sold a few products at first but the business has grown, thanks to the efforts she has maD. to build it, and she can now count on an established customer base who regularly buy from her. Maria buys basic commodities in Chiclayo, always trying to find fresh produce (vegetables, fruits) for her customers. Her business is one of the best supplied in the neighborhood, a great service to her neighbors. Nueva Arica is a sparsely populated area (14 people per square kilometer). Maria Confesora wants to expand her business by buying fresh produce. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles that she wants to use toward that end. Maria is an honest and hard-working woman. She is much admired in her neighborhood and looked to by her neighbors as someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
B. Moses has, for over twenty-one years, been selling maize as his source of income. His business prospers on the basis that foods prepared with maize flour are in high favor with many Ugandans. In the photo, Moses is the one wearing the jacket.

In Wakitaka, this 35-year-old married man is referred to as an early riser: one who rises with the lark. He is a stickler for hard work and, as such, his three children are all basking in the glow of his enterprising nature. His business brings him monthly profits of 120,000 shillings.

Moses is looking at a scenario where his business will expand with aplomb. The only way he sees this materializing is when he obtains a loan. With it he wants to buy more maize.

loans.use: To buy more maize for his business

loans.name: Wilma Monica

texts.es: LA SRA. WILMA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA YA QUE TIENE UNA PENSION ALQUILADA DONDE HACE VARIEDAD DE PLATOS PARA LA VENTA, LA CLIENTE VIVE CON LA MAMA Y CON SU HIJITA YA QUE ES MAMA SOLTERA Y  CON LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA SOLA MANTIENE SU HOGAR, SE PUDO VERIFICAR QUE LA CLIENTE ESTA SALIENDO ADELANTE CON NUESTROS CREDITO YA QUE IMPLEMENTO EL NEGOCIO CON EQUIPOS DE SONIDO Y UN TELEVISOR, LA SRA. WILMA DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS POR LO QUE SE LE DIO LA TASA PREFERENCIAL KIVA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS E INGREDIENTES AL POR MAYOR COMO ARROZ, VARIEDAD DE FIDEOS, ACEITE, PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS DELICIOSAS COMIDAS, ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA , ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Wilma earns her living selling food, renting a space where she prepares a variety of meals to sell. She's a single mother and lives with her mother and little daughter. She is her household's the sole breadwinner. We know that she is succeeding with our loans because she has installed a sound system and a TV at her business. Because Wilma has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments, she has gotten the preferred interest rate from Kiva. She plans to use her loan to buy supplies and ingredients wholesale, including rice, assorted noodles, and oil, to prepare her delicious meals. She is a hard-working woman and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown in granting her loans.
