Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des médicaments naturels

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carla Patricia D. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Analista de Presupuesto  es soltera  y tiene un hijo a su cargo y en edad escolar  habita carretera a León.

La señora Carla Patricia D. lleva ya  tres años trabajando con CEPRODEL  y ha demostrado ser una persona de principios y emprendedora, ella solicito financiamiento para cambiar laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Patricia works for the Chinandega mayor's office as a budget analyst. She is single and has a school-age son in her charge. They live on the highway to León. Carla has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 years and has demonstrated herself to be an enterprising person of principles. She is requesting financing to install rafters and new zinc sheeting for the roof of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RAFTERS AND ZINC SHEETING, AND PAYING FOR INSTALLATION

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive en la zona Heliodoro Camacho de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia. Trabaja como albañil independiente en diferentes obras de la ciudad y el departamento.
Actualmente trabaja en una construcción en la ciudad de Cochabamba. 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de material de construcción, como ser cemento, ladrillo, estuco, etc., para la refacción de su  vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Heliodoro Camacho neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He lives in a house he owns. He makes a living as a construction worker, working on various jobs in both the city and the surrounding area. For now, he's working on a job in the city of Cochabamba. Juan will use the loan to buy construction materials--cement, bricks, stucco, etc.--to make repairs to his house. This is Juan's first IMPRO loan, a loan that he was granted after an evaluation showed that he qualifies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building materials for house repair.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier V. P.  es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante habita en el barrio  Julio Cesar Tinoco, tiene cuatro hijos a cargo,  es casado y su señora se dedica a la venta de verduras  ambulante.

El señor Francisco Javier V. P.  solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda, lleva ya dos años trabajando con CEPRODEL  y ha sido muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier works for the mayor's office in Chinandega as a night watchman and lives in the Julio César Tinoco barrio. He has 4 children in his charge, is married, and his wife sells vegetables as a street vendor. Francisco Javier is requesting a loan for home improvement. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years and has been very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOOD AND ZINC SHEETS FOR HOME IMPROVEMENTS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos es un cliente nuevo que se dedica al transporte publico y tambien trabaja medio tiempo con su minibus como Gondola del Colegio Monserrat de la zona de Chasquipampa, ya van tres años que el señor se dedica a este rubro ya que antes trabajaba como auditor en una  empresa de la ciudad de el alto, gracias al buen salario que recibio de esta institucion el señor pudo contruir su casa de 500 mts en la zona de pedregal y tambien alquilar su anterior casa en la ciudad de El Alto, ua vez terminado el domicilio donde vive actualmente el señor Juan Carlos se dio cuenta de que habia dejado descuidada la relacion con su unico hijo y esposa, es por eso que decidio dejar el trabajo y dedicarse al transporte publico y estar mas tiempo en casa. Actualmente don Juan Carlos es propietario de tres automoviles, dos toyotas y un Minibus, el  automovil del cual recibe renta piensa venderlo uno de sus autos al actual chofer (solo le faltan los papeles para cerrar el trato) y con ese dinero de esta venta y mas el monto de este credito piensa comprar un nuevo auto Toyota Sprinter. La idea del señor tomar de nuevo un trabajo relacionado con su carrera y hacer trabajar las tres movilidades para aumentar sus ingresos. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a new client who works in public transportation. He also uses his minibus as a part time school bus for the Monserrat School in the Chasquipampa area. He has worked in this field for three years. Before that he worked as an auditor for a company in the city of El Alto. Thanks to the good salary he received from this institution, he was able to build a 50 square meter house in the Pedregal area. He also rents his previous house in the city of El Alto. Once he finished the house where he currently lives, Juan Carlos realized that he had neglected his relationship with his only child and his wife. Therefore, he decided to leave his job and work in public transportation in order to spend more time at home. Juan Carlos currently owns three automobiles, two Toyotas and a minibus. He is thinking of selling one of the cars he rents out to the current driver (they only need the papers to close the deal). With this money from selling the automobile and the money from this loan he plans on buying a new car, a Toyota Sprinter. His idea is to once again work in the area of his career and to make the three automobiles work for him to increase his income. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Iris Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Iris R. se trabaja en un centro de labores en el departamento de Chinandega y se ha esforzado para llevar a cabo la mejora de su vivienda invirtiendo en el mejoramiento y reconstrucción de esta que así lo necesita.

Para ello, la señora Iris necesita del capital para realizar dicha obra y es por esta razón que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, clavos y cemento para realizar esta obra y así salir adelante brindandole a su propia familia un techo digno donde habitar juntos.
texts.en:
Iris Raquel R. González is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega. She works as an accountant’s assistant. She has a life partner, but does not have children. Her husband is an industrial technician, and he has his own shop. Iris Raquel R. González has been working with Ceprodel for six years, and she has shown herself to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, blocks, and cement

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 52 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, del cual tiene un puesto en un mercado céntrico de su ciudad. Es así que su actividad comienza todas las mañanas, ofreciendo a sus asiduos clientes desayunos y almuerzos, ellos muy gustosos de consumir los platos típicos que prepara Leonarda. Algunas veces sus hijos la apoyan en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes, puesto que este negocio que ha elegido requiere de mucho esfuerzo, ya que para lograr las ganancias que necesita, debe levantarse a las 4 de la madrugada para preparar la comida,.  Ella ha sabido conquistar a sus clientes por la buena sazón y la atención cálida que ofrece, es por ello que su negocio es rentable. Con el tiempo espera mejorar la fachada de su negocio, por el momento continuará trabajando hasta concretar sus objetivos. Esta es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus, manifiesta además que éste aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de ingredientes e insumos, así como alimentos no perecibles, para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 52, lives with her 3 children in a house that she owns. For 15 years, she has made a living selling prepared meals from a stand at the city's main market. That's where she starts work every morning, providing breakfast and lunch to her loyal customers, all of whom are eager to enjoy the traditional dishes that Leonarda prepares for them. Her children help her sometimes, waiting on customers, because this is a business that requires a lot of hard work. To make the money she needs, she has to get up at 4 in the morning to prepare her meals, but she's learned to win over her customers with good seasoning and attentive service that have helped to keep the business profitable. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her stand but, for now, she'll continue working on meeting her goals. This is Leonarda's seventh MFP loan and she is committed to using it responsibly. She says, too, that this help will be very useful in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy wholesale stocks of the ingredients she needs along with other supplies for making her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Doña Luisa es una mujer activa, trabaja como conserje desde hace varios años, para una institución de investigación, con españoles, junto con su esposo han logrado hacer su casa, el trabaja como albañil, en donde se ha favorecido en no pagar la mano de obra.  Sus crédito lo ha invertido en las mejoras de su casa el cual se ha beneficiado para estas mejoras. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción y  comenzara a construir otro cuarto el cual lo hará con arranque de piedra y forrado de zinc para suplir la necesidad de tener espacio para su familia, dos hijos  de los cuales siempre están con ellas. Y con el tiempo poder ir mejorando la infraestructura de piedra.
texts.en:
Luisa is an active woman. For several years she has worked as a janitor for a Spanish investigation institution. She and her husband have been able to build their house together. He works as a bricklayer, so they did not have to pay for the labor. Her loans have been invested in making improvements to her house. The improvements have been beneficial. With this loan she will buy construction materials and start building another room. It will be started with blocks, and zinc will be used to cover it. This will be done because the family needs to have more space. They have two children, and they are always with them. In time they will be able to continue improving the block infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy block, sand, cement, timber, nails, and zinc to make a room

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro C. M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como responsable de bodega  habita en el barrio Roberto González, es casado y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo dos tiene a su cargo los demás ya son independientes.

El señor Isidro C. M. Solicito crédito para cubrir unos gastos familiares, es muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Isidro C. M. is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega. He is in charge of the warehouse. He lives in the Roberto González neighborhood. He is married and has five children. Only two of them are under his care, the rest are independent. Isidro C. M. asked for the loan to pay for some family expenses. He is very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón G. M. es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como responsable de bienes habita en el barrio ayapal es casado con dos hijos  a su cargo.

El señor Juan Ramón G. solicita crédito para mejorar sus condiciones  de vida ya que desea ampliar un poco más su casa y hacer unas reparaciones en su baño, el señor llevar ya cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón G. M. works as an asset manager at the Chinandega City Hall. He lives in the Ayapal neighborhood, and is married with two children under his care. Mr. G. is seeking a loan to improve his quality of life. He would like to enlarge his house a bit more and do some repairs to his bathroom. He has been working with CEPRODEL for five years now and has shown himself to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, blocks, and cement.

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zoraida de edad de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada al trabajo, desde hace varios años tiene una pulpería que logro iniciar con ayuda de su esposo económica, pues tiene una camioneta en el cual la trabaja para hacer acarreo. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian y ayudan en casa, el mayor trabaja. Cuando inicio su pequeño negocio lo hizo con pocos productos vendiendo leña, frutas y verduras. Con las ganancias de la venta, logran la alimentación, gastos básicos, en todo este tiempo no le ha alcanzado para hacer las mejoras a su pequeña casa que aun es forrada con madera y de tierra lo que quisiera mejorar para el bienestar de sus hijos. Con este crédito podrá comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento para quitar madera y cerrar toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Contenta por que se ha beneficiado con estos préstamos que invertidos en su casa y en su venta.
texts.en:
Dona Zoraida, 38, is a hard-working woman. She has operated a small general store for several years, a business that she started with help from her husband who has a truck that he uses to make deliveries for the store. The couple has four children, three of whom are in school and able to help around the house. The oldest works. She started the business with only a handful of products, selling firewood, fruits and vegetables. With her earnings, she was able to buy food and everyday supplies but the money never stretched far enough to make improvements to her little house, a house built from wood and earth that Zoraida would like to improve for the well-being of her children. She will use this loan to buy construction materials--stone, sand, cement--so that she can remove the wood and enclose the entire structure in concrete, something that will better secure the house. She is happy to have received this loan and past ones because they have helped her to improve both her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvement project.

loans.name: Lapaz Tb Group

texts.en:
Esther A. describes herself as hard-working, a woman for whom no challenge is too great. She is 30 years old and is the leader of the 'Lapaz' borrower group. Esther lives in Safwi and bakes bread. She has been baking bread for 7 years. Esther is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase three bags of flour, one bag of sugar and two packs of margarine. 

She wants to use the extra profits she anticipates as a result of this loan to buy a plot of land to start building accommodation for her family. 

She is married to a commercial driver and together they have three children. Esther hopes to make more savings to be able to provide good education for all of her children, hopefully through University level. 

Esther is currently the leader of the trust bank group called Lapaz, made up of seven members. The other members are engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales, etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are looking for this loan to support their business and eventually raise more income to support their families.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca K. is 37 years old and married to James K., who is a 45-year-old policeman. They live in Kabarnet Town. They have been blessed with three children: Hezbon (14 years old and in Form 2), Faith (12 years old and in Class 8) and Tony (9 years old and in Class 5).

Mrs. Prisca K. runs an agro-vet shop. She started this business 10 years ago. She gets a profit of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month and an additional income of Kshs 3,000 from other sources.

She has borrowed Kshs 70,000 for her second loan from KADET, a Kiva partner. She plans to use Kshs 28,000 to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer. She will use the balance for tilling and renting land.

Prisca has never borrowed a loan from any other financial institution other than KADET. Existing clients introduced her to KADET. Prisca’s business is near a Tobil Petrol Station. Most of her customers are farmers in Kabarnet Town and its vicinity.

If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra income to expand her maize-farming business. She dreams and hopes of expanding the agro-vet business and purchasing a plot of land, which she will develop. She describes herself as hardworking and creative.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items and clothes to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor Miguel  es un cliente antiguo que trabaja con la institucion desde el año 2007, el trabaja con pequeños contratos en domicilios y condominios por la zona de Bella Vista, el vive por la misma zona junto a su esposa Lidia y su pequeña de nueve años, la casa de don Miguel no se vio afectada por los derrumbes a causa de las fuerte lluvias en nuestra ciudad pero si considera que es mejor prevenir cualquier desastre y es por eso que piensa hacer una ampliacion y techado a su domicilio levantando un living comedor y asi cubrir todo el espacio abierto que queda en su casa. El credito que se le otorgara ayudara al señor a terminar por lo menos la obra bruta y para cuando termine este credito se pensara en un incremento para la obra fina, y asi evitar que en epoca de lluvias afecte  a su domicilio, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en laa otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Miguel is a long-standing client of the institution having started his collaboration with us in 2007; he works small contracts in homes and condominiums in the Bella Vista area where he lives with his wife, Lidia, and their 9-year-old daughter. Miguel’s home was not affected by the recent collapses caused by the heavy rains in the city. However, he feels that it is better to prevent any possible disaster so he means to improve his home’s roof and enlarge his home adding a living room/dining room thus roofing all the available open space in his house. The funds granted will be sufficient, at best, to cover the rough construction; he will consider requesting an increase to cover finishing touches later so that the rainy season will not damage his home. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home enlargement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of drinks

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde M. de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene una casa de cemento si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es maestro albañil ellos tienen 2 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Cleotilde comenzó cosiendo en una maquina de coser vieja que le prestaron poco a poco con unos cuantos ahorros decidió invertir su dinero en unas telas y algodón para hacer muñecas de trapo y así vender a sus vecinos.

Ahora ella tiene 20 años haciendo muñecas de trapos para sus clientes y almacenes gracias a estos buenos ingresos ella pudo implementar un nuevo negocio de ventas de cilindros de gas, pero continúa como costurera. La casa de ella es en una loma de Paraíso de Guayaquil y es muy difícil trasladar los cilindros de gas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cilindros de gas para su nuevo negocio y poder ayudar a su familia con más ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener su casa terminada y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Cleotilde M., 47, lives in Paraiso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. She owns a house made of cement and has all the basic services. Her husband is a long-time construction worker and they have 2 children, both in school. Cleotilde began sewing on an old borrowed sewing machine. She decided to use her small savings to buy materials and cotton wadding to start a business making rag dolls that she sold in the neighborhood. She has been making the dolls for 20 years now, selling them to individuals and stores. Thanks to the earnings from the business, she was able to set up another business selling gas cylinders for cooking, but she's never given up the doll-making business. Her house is on a hill in Paraiso de Guayaquil and, consequently, it's very hard to move the gas cylinders back and forth. Cleotilde will use this loan to buy gas cylinders for her new business and, in turn, generate extra income for her family. In the future, she wants to finish her house and see her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR BRAULIO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD, COMO SER: SARDINAS ENLATADAS, FIDEO, ARROZ, AZUCAR,, TAMBIEN VENDE CARNE, Y OTROS INSUMOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD.

EL SEÑOR VIVE EN UNA PEQUEÑA CASA CON SU ESPOSA Y SU HIJITA DE 3 AÑOS DE EDAD, EL SE LEVANTA A ABRIR SU TIENDA DESDE LAS 5:30 DE LA MADRUGADA, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA EL ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER BASTANTE CUMPLIDO EN SUS  PAGOS, SU TIENDA ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE EL MAICA  A 20 KILOMETROS DE COCHABAMBA TIENE UNA TIENDA SURTIDA DONDE  OFRECE TODOS LOS PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD. 
                                                         
EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRASE UN HELADERA PARA HACER ENFRIAR LOS REFRESCOS QUE VENDE.           EL SEÑOR ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y CON LOS SOCIOS DE KIVA, POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Braulio has a small grocery store where he sells basic items like: canned sardines, pasta, rice, sugar, meat and other supplies. He lives in a small house with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. He rises at 5:30am to open his store for business. He is a responsible, hard-working person. He qualified for the loan because he has made his payments on time. His store is in Maica which is 20 kilometers from Cochabamba. His store is well-stocked with all basic items. He will use the funds to buy a refrigerated display case to cool his soft-drinks. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva members for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerated display case.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
María Luz tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito ubicado a dos horas de Chiclayo y que se caracteriza por tener un territorio bastante accidentado debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país (limita con la región Cajamarca), su principal actividad es la agricultura.

Lleva mas de 10 años vendiendo cerveza en un pequeño bar ubicado en su vivienda, el negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, por este motivo ella da lo mejor de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

El negocio es bastante conocido en la zona y ha ido creciendo poco a poco, María Luz desea ampliarlo con la compra de más bebidas de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevo soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Luz es una mujer alegre y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Luz, 40, lives with her family in Oyotun, about two hours from Chiclayo, in a hilly region at the foot of the mountains of northern Peru (and near the border with the Cajamarca region). Her main source of income is farming. For more than 10 years, she has sold beer in a small bar that she runs from her house. The business is an important source of revenue for the family because Maria Luz's husband's income as a farmer isn't enough to cover the family's expenses. For that reason, she gives her all to advancing the business. The business has become well-known in the area after growing little by little. Maria Luz wants to expand further by adding products that her customers want and, consequently, she's applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new soles loan to help her meet that demand. Maria Luz is a happy woman, devoted to her family, and her greatest wish is to provide them with a better quality of life. She is well-known and respected in the neighborhood and her neighbors consider her to be someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for bar business.

loans.name: Romalda

texts.es: Romalda tiene 32 años, tiene 2 hijos y juntos viven en una casa al cual ella cuida. Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de comida, siendo los días miércoles y sábados que ofrece sus potajes en las ferias comerciales en su localidad. Paralelamente a ello, y durante los demás días que tiene, realiza labores agrícolas, cuidando sus cultivos que tiene sobre terrenos arrendados. Estas actividades, la ayudan económicamente para sostener a sus 2 hijos, que aún están en etapa escolar. Ella sabe que todo trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio y es por esta razón que continuará trabajando y mejorando su puesto de venta de comida, por lo que requerira de nuevos implementos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y manifiesta que le será  muy útil éste aporte para el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una carpa para que ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes y vender con mayor seguridad sus comidas, que lo realiza de manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Romalda, 32, has 2 children with whom she lives in a house that she takes care of. For three years, she has earned extra income from selling prepared meals, going on Wednesdays and Saturdays to sell her product in nearby markets. In addition to that, she works as a share-cropper, tending crops on rented land. The two sources of income allow her to support her 2 children, both of whom are still in school. She knows that all work requires sacrifice and, consequently, she keeps on working and improving her food business for which she now needs new supplies. This is Romalda's third MFP loan. She has been very responsible about repaying past loans and she tells us that this loan will help her efforts to improve the business. She will use the loan to buy a tent so that she can make her customers more comfortable and so that she can more easily sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tent for food business.

loans.name: Progressive Tb Group

texts.en:
Gifty A. is a women’s leader and a role model to most young women in her community. She is thirty-nine years old, married and the mother of six children from age 3-20 years who are pursuing their education at primary and high school levels. She lives together with her husband who is a food crop farmer and their children in a town close to Mampong.

Gifty is a petty trader who sells rice, tomatoes, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. to customers in her community. Operating her business for the past one and half years, Gifty has amassed good marketing experience and drawn many customers to her business.  

Gifty is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Progressive', made up of thirteen members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses with the hope of raising more income to support their families. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries like tomatoes, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Iccel Amanda M. S., tiene 31 años de edad es originaria de Santa Lucia, Boaco, es casada y juntos tienen un niño pequeño, ellos tienen una pulpería y es su esposo quien la administra, ellos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, un populoso Barrio de la capital que según los Records Policiales, obtiene una alta calificación de inseguridad social.

El capital circulante de la familia, ha mostrado bajas en los últimos meses, las ventas del negocio no han dado los mejores resultados que esperaban, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo para la reinversión en su negocio, en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería y de esta manera, elevar el volumen en las ventas, este préstamo a futuro le favorecerá a la familia M.,  el capital necesario para realizar mejoras al hogar que contribuyan a la seguridad personal y la de su familia, debido al ambiente en el que se habita actualmente en su comunidad. En otras ocasiones han tenido prestamos gracias al apoyo de los fondos Kiva, fue gracias a su esfuerzo personal y a los créditos, que ha logrado mejorar día a día sus condiciones económicas-sociales así también las de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Iccel Amanda M. S., 31, is a native of Santa Lucia, Boaco. She and her husband have one young son. They own a small general store that is managed by her husband. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, a heavily populated neighborhood of Managua that police records show to be one of the city's most crime-ridden. The business hasn't generated much income over the last few month because sales have been lower than expected. Iccel is applying for a loan so that she can refinance the business. She expects to buy better merchandise and, in turn, increase the store's sales volumes. This loan will greatly help the M. family in the future by helping them to generate the income they need to make improvements to their house, improvements that will contribute to making them safer in a neighborhood that is not very safe. They have received other loans from Kiva in the past. Thanks to their own efforts and past loans, they have been able to improve the lives of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Isha Allah Group

texts.en:
M. Lawuratu is also a wife and the mother of three children who are ten, nine, and two years old. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. Her husband is also hard-working. He is a trader who sells used clothes and together they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

M. trades in cereals such maize. She purchases maize from local farmers in surrounding village and sells to customers. She has helped sustain her family through this business for the past five years.

M. is currently the leader of a trust bank group called "Isha Allah" (translated as 'God's grace'), made up of nine members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales, etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Sol radiante de Huaycan”, está conformada por 9 socios quienes se desempeñan en labores de comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad hace 2 años.
Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedidos mediante este negocio puede aportar con los gastos en casa, ella tiene 3 hijos por los cuales esforzarse asi que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar otros productos para comercializar en esta temporada.
Erlinda tiene un pequeño negocio de helados de diferentes marcas en el verano y en el invierno prepara comidas calientes así puede aportar con los gastos en casa ya que tiene 6 hijos. Pero desea ampliar su negocio, así que el préstamo lo invertirá en arreglar su congeladora para poder mantener su mercadería.
texts.en:
The “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” (Shining Sun of Huaycan) communal bank is composed of 9 members who are small retail merchants; they have been collaborating with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for two years. Gloria sells clothes on order; this makes it possible for her to contribute to her family’s support. She has three children for whom she must exert herself; she will use the funds to buy other products to sell during this season. Erlinda sells a variety of frozen treats in summer; in winter she prepares hot meals in order to contribute to her family’s income; she has 6 children. She wants to enlarge her business so she will use the funds to buy a freezer so that she can preserve her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Julio Armando

texts.es:
El señor Julio Armando O. O. es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Tesorero, es casado y tiene tres hijos pero solo uno a su cargo y estudia en la Universidad, lleva ya cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL  y le ha ayudado enormemente en la preparación de carrera de sus hijos pues dos de ellos ya culminaron sus estudios Universitarios.

El señor Julio Armando O. O. ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus obligaciones y dedicado a la preparación de sus hijos para que en un futuro sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Julio Armando O. O. is employed as a treasurer by the city of Chinandega; he’s married and has three children, only one of whom, who is a university student, is still under his care. He has collaborated with CEPRODEL for five years and this has been an enormous help to him in paying for his other two children’s professional preparation; both have finished their university studies. Julio Armando O. O. has proven to be a responsible person who is dedicated to preparing his children so that they will be upstanding citizens in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his son's university fees and for school supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz del Socorro R. S., tiene la edad de 29 años habita con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ellos son una familia muy humilde, ella labora desde hace 4 años a vendiendo Panadería de la Repostería Norma y el señor labora como chofer de automóviles. 

Dentro de las necesidades que agoban a la familia, esta la construcción de su vivienda, debido a que actualmente, viven en un cuarto con todos sus hijos en precarias condiciones habitacionales, los pocos ingresos que tiene la familia imposibilita la compra de materiales de construcción para el emprendimiento de dicho proyecto, hasta el momento lo único que han podido comprar ha sido 200 bloques, razón por la cual solicitan un préstamo para realizar las compras necesarias para dar inicio a las edificaciones, este apoyo les servirá para encaminara sus hijos en un ambiente hogareño que favorezca al crecimiento social de su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz del Socorro R. Sanchez, age 29, lives with her husband and her two children in the Juan Ramón Padilla housing development. They are a very humble family. She has worked for four years selling for Norma’s Bakery and Pastries. Her husband works as a driver. One of the family’s great needs is building their house. They currently live in one room with all of their children. Their living conditions are precarious. The family’s small income makes it impossible to buy construction materials to start this project. The only things they have been able to buy are 200 blocks. That is the reason they are asking for a loan to make the necessary purchases to start building. This help will serve to lead their children to a homey environment that favors the social growth of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her house

loans.name: Mariama T.

texts.en:
Mariama T. K. is married with three children. She started her sales of drinks with funds from her husband. Over the years her business has been doing well little by little and now she intends diversify her goods.

With her four years experience in her trade, Mariama is therefore soliciting a loan to buy more stock and generate more income. As a result, she intends to participate fully in the education of her children, establish a cinema, and construct a dwelling house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy drinks and and food

loans.name: Musi

texts.en:
Born in 1955, Musi E. is married with seven children and she is unemployed. Although she attributes her unemployment to her low education, she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small for her kids.

E.’s inability to obtain investment capital which could constantly generate income for her to meet her children’s needs, is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. With her previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with foodstuffs from her farm and puff puff (Cameroon-style doughnuts). She has taken and repaid loans twice from GHAPE.

Given the loan, E. plans to buy flour, onions, tomatoes, palm oil and seedlings. This investment will increase the food supply in the community. She is planning to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater to the basic needs of her family.

Elizaberth’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more flour, onions, tomatoes, palm oil and seedlings

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Luis Guillermo H. C. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante habita en el barrio la florida  es casado  y solo tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El señor Luis Guillermo H. solicito el crédito para mejorar el piso de su casa ya que lo tiene un poco rustico de cemento, ya lleva cuatro años de trabajar con CEPRODEL  y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luis Guillermo H. C. is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega where he works as a security guard. He lives in the La Florida neighborhood, is married, and has a school-aged son. Luis Guillermo is asking for a loan which will be used to improve the flooring in his house, which is currently made of cement and is rather basic. He has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and has shown that he is very responsible with repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks, cement, and labor

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora E. es trabajadora de la escuela Efrain Tijerino Mazariego de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada habita en el barrio Santa Ana, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
  La señora María Auxiliadora E. tiene dos años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación y lo cancelo en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones y esta vez lo invertirá siempre en mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
La señora María Auxiliadora E. es trabajadora de la escuela Efrain Tijerino Mazariego de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada habita en el barrio Santa Ana, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. La señora María Auxiliadora E. tiene dos años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación y lo cancelo en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones y esta vez lo invertirá siempre en mejoras de su casa.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción (zinc, perlines, clavos, mano de obra

loans.name: María Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora María Gregoria G. C. es casada de profesión profesora de primaria desde hace once años en el colegio Efraín Tijerino Mazariego, vive en la colonia Santa Ana tiene cinco hijos dos viven bajo su responsabilidad los otros ya se casaron.

La señora María Gregoria G. C. tiene dos años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación, pero necesita cambiar unas laminas de zinc por que se le pasa el agua, la señora Maria Gregoria ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maria Gregoria G. C. lives in the Santa Ana neighborhood. She is married and has five children. Two of the children are under her care, and the others are already married. For eleven years, Maria Gregoria has been an elementary school teacher in the Efraín Tijerino Mazariego school. Maria Gregoria has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She used the previous loan to make improvements to her home, and now she needs to change some of the leaky roofing sheets. Maria Gregoria has shown that she is very responsible in meeting her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (metal roofing sheets, nails, labor)

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
Yayah J. is a businessman who owns a pharmacy along the Old Koribondo Road in the city of Bo. His pharmacy is registered and licensed through the Pharmacy Board of Sierra Leone to sell drugs.

Yayah is married with four children. His wife assists him in the pharmacy when he goes out to sell in the neighboring villages where he has customers. He is very committed to his business.

Yayah is in need of a loan to buy more drugs to satisfy his customers and hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to buy a motorbike to use when distributing his stock to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for increased sales

loans.name: Kuoh

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Kuoh J. is married and has three children. He faces difficulties in taking care of his family, especially when they are sick.

Kuoh had been having difficulties trying to raise business capital. He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had repayment problems due to high interest rates.

Dressmaking is a very profitable trade in his community so he decided to obtain a loan from GHAPE in order to carry out this trade. He has received and repaid loans twice from GHAPE. He knows he will succeed in the trade because he has been doing this trade for a very long time and also has so many customers.

J.’ loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and thread

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata K. is an active and very committed businesswoman who sells in Tobu market, one of the most popular and attractive business centres in the city of Bo. She sells food condiments which she is always busy serving to her customers.

Aminata is married to a photographer who monitors her greatly to see that her business prospers. She has three children and helps her husband to care for the children's schooling.

Aminata is in search of a loan to buy more foodstuffs that will increase her income. She intends using the proceeds of her loan to assist her husband in running the home and to save some funds for construction in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena M. S. es soltera comerciante ambulante, tiene cinco hijos dos de  ellos dependen de ella , habita en el barrio Narciso Zepeda de el Viejo
La señora Martha M. es primera vez que trabajo con crédito en esta institución. El crédito solicitado lo utilizara para realizar unas mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Ya que se aproxima el invierno
texts.en:
La señora Martha Lorena M. S. es soltera comerciante ambulante, tiene cinco hijos dos de ellos dependen de ella , habita en el barrio Narciso Zepeda de el Viejo La señora Martha M. es primera vez que trabajo con crédito en esta institución. El crédito solicitado lo utilizara para realizar unas mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Ya que se aproxima el invierno

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar materiales de construcción ) Hierro, Bloques, Cemento y 15 laminas de zincpara comprar productos para su venta

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Dorothy M. is married to Mr Leo Munangl and they are blessed with nine children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when Dorothy was still very young, and when she finds it difficult to assist her husband to pay for their children’s education and to provide for the basic needs of their children.

Dorothy has twice successfully obtained and repaid loans from GHAPE. The inability to get enough investment capital which could give her a higher income to meet her children’s an family’s needs, motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. She thinks her business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a very long time.
Dorothy’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more corn, palm oil, kerosene and salt

loans.name: Pedro Noel

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Vigilante en el plantel, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos todos a su cargo,  habita en el barrio de Guadalupe.

El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz lleva cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL y a pagados sus créditos en tiempo y forma, el señor D. solicito el crédito para reparar las tuberías de su casa ya  que tiene fuga y el recibo del agua le sale por las nubes.
texts.en:
El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Vigilante en el plantel, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos todos a su cargo, habita en el barrio de Guadalupe. El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz lleva cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL y a pagados sus créditos en tiempo y forma, el señor D. solicito el crédito para reparar las tuberías de su casa ya que tiene fuga y el recibo del agua le sale por las nubes.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de tuberías pvc, tubo madre, pega, mano de obra.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20-year-old young woman from Ramallah. Her family runs a carpentry workshop where they produce furniture, wooden structures, cupboards, tables, chairs, etc. Since the workshop is the only source of income for the family, Wisam took the second loan from FATEN to purchase a wood-cutting band saw to replace the old one.

Wisam tells us that her father started the project 12 years ago, and he established an excellent reputation for his great work quality and ability to meet deadlines, which is reflected in the workshop's number of customers. She hopes that by purchasing the band saw, she will help her father do his work faster and more efficiently, and improve the family's financial situation. 

Wisam's father appears in the picture above in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting band saw

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena M. es soltera tiene cinco hijos ninguno a su cargo solo un nieto a su cargo habita  en el barrio la florida hace 20 años, tiene su negocio en el mercado bisne sector comida, vende tortillas desde hace 15 años, además de su negocio tiene otros ingresos por servicio de un triciclos.  

 La señora María Magdalena M. tiene seis años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado veinticinco créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad en cuanto a obligaciones contraídas, los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio e ir evolucionando.
texts.en:
María Magdalena M. is single and has five children. She only has a grandson under her care. She has lived in the La Florida neighborhood for 20 years. She has had her tortilla sales business in the food section of the El Bisne market for 15 years; in addition, she earns extra income with her three-wheeled vehicle. María Magdalena M. has managed loans for 6 years having repaid 25 in a timely fashion. She used her prior loans to keep her business running and evolving.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale corn and firewood and some personal items for the home.

loans.name: Gabriel T. S.

texts.en:
Gabriel T. S. S. is a trader as well as being on the staff of the new Harvest Ministry as an evaluation officer. He sells and rents bridal dresses, ties, ladies’ bags and caps along Prince Williams Street, Bo.

Gabriel is married with two children and both are attending school. His wife assists him greatly at the shop when he is at work.

Gabriel has vast knowledge in business with about four years experience. He is seeking a loan that he will use to to acquire more stock for his shop and, as a result, cater to his customers' needs.

Gabriel intends to use the proceeds from the loan to start the construction of his house and cater for his children.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' wear and men's wear

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 55 años, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, está casado con Alberta de 54 años, juntos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, hecho de  material rústico. Desde hace más de 25 años, que se dedica al cuidado de frutas cítricas, plátanos y paltas, adicionalmente tiene un negocio de acopio de frutas oriundas de la selva peruana.  En la etapa de cosecha, cuenta con la ayuda de su amada esposa y la de su hijo mayor, consiguiendo así poder brindarle una vida cómoda a su familia. Dentro de su oficio de comerciante, le gusta atender a sus clientes, sin embargo le desagrada cargar los pesados cajones que lleva al mercado para venderlos. Para su futuro, desea comprar más hectáreas de terrenos que le permitan plantar café en mayor cantidad, de esa manera sus hijos puedan cosecharlo y con ello puedan beneficiarse. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y confía que sus cosechas serán exitosas como hasta ahora, por eso está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal, por ser todos muy unidos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, arrendará un terreno amplio, en donde plantará frutas cítricas, además piensa comprar docenas de sacos de fertilizantes e insecticidas parta evitar que las plagas consuman sus frutos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55. He is an honest and hardworking man who is married to Alberta, 54. Together they have 3 children, of whom only one still lives with them in their own house: a house constructed of rustic materials. For more than 25 years, he has worked with citrus fruit, bananas and avocados. On top of that he has a business of supplying native fruit from the Peruvian jungle. In harvest times, he has the help of his dear wife and of his oldest son. This way he can give a comfortable life to his family. In his business when he is selling, he likes to take care of his customers. Nevertheless, he doesn’t like to carry the heavy crates that he takes to market to sell the fruit. In the future we would like to buy more hectares of land that would allow him to plant a large quantity of coffee. In this way his children can harvest the coffee and they can get earnings from the crop. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he tells us that his crops will be as successful as they are now. He is happy to work with the communal group since the members are all united. With the three thousand new sols that he is requesting, he will lease a bigger field where he will plant citrus fruit. Besides that he wants to buy dozens of sacks of fertilizer and insecticides to avoid the infestations that eat his fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a field and buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona del Rosario M. es soltera de profesión, profesora de primaria desde hace quince años en la escuela Efraín Tijerino Mazariego, vive en reparto José Benito Centeno tiene dos hijos pero solo uno depende de ella.

La señora Ramona del Rosario M. es primer vez que trabaja con crédito en esta institución con el fin de realizar la construcción de un  cuarto en su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Ramona del Rosario M. is single; she has been an elementary school teacher at Efraín Tijerino Mazariego school for 15 years. She lives in José Benito Centeno neighborhood and has two children but only one still depends on her. This is her first loan with this institution and she will use the funds to add a room to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Antonio De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Antonio de la Cruz A. V. es casado tiene tres hijos menores en edada escolar habita en el reparto francisco palavicine. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace diez años como operario de limpieza pública
El señor Antonio de la Cruz A. V. ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en lo que a obligación respecta, todos estos crédito los ha utilizado para ayudarse ha mantener estables su familia y mejorar su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Antonio de la Cruz A. V. is married and has three, school-aged children; he lives in the Francisco Palavicine neighborhood and has been a municipal employee for 10 years. Antonio de la Cruz A. V. has repaid five previous loans in a timely fashion. He used all the loans to help himself maintain his family stability and to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for the family.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.es:
Elmo es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijas en la ciudad de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia de mismo nombre ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace mas de siete años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa y diversa mercadería de modo ambulante en la zonas de la sierra cercanas al lugar como San Miguel, Agua Blanca, Chilete (poblaciones pertenecientes a la región Cajamarca). El negocio le ha brindado diversos ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia durante todos estos años, como es su única fuente de ingreso el trata de esforzarse todos los dias para sacar adelante a su negocio, eventualmente su esposa también le ayuda a vender los productos que ofrece.

Elmo ha venido trabajando con su propio capital durante todos estos años, ahora desea agenciarse de un capital adicional para ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas mercadería.

Elmo es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos, su mayor anhelo es poder remodelar su domicilio ya que esta construido de material rústico y de techo de quincha, lo que genera mucha humedad y afecta la salud de sus menores hijas.
texts.en:
Elmo is a 49-year-old father who lives with his wife and two young daughters in the city of Chepén, which belongs to the province of the same name in the region of Libertad. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. He started his business in which he sells clothing and various merchandise more than 7 years ago. He sells these items as a traveling salesman in the nearby areas like San Miguel, Agua Blanca, and Chilete (towns that belong to the region of Cajamarca). His business has given him economic income that he has used to take care of his family during these years. Since it is his only source of income, he strives every day to progress his business. His wife also helps him sell the products that he offers. Elmo has worked with his own capital during all of these years. Now he hopes to obtain additional capital to expand his business and to improve his family's quality of life. This is why he is requesting his first credit of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternatitva, which he plans to use to buy more merchandise. Elmo is a hard-working father who always watches over his family's well-being and development. His biggest dream is to remodel his home since it is constructed of rustic materials and has a thatched roof, which generates humidity and affects the health of his young daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and merchandise to expand his traveling sales business

loans.name: Vilma Corina

texts.es:
Vilma V. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (la zona por donde vive esta muy cerca del estero de la Perimetral), tiene una casa de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Esta divorciada pero tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Vilma empezó vendiendo legumbres en las afuera de su casa pero uno de sus sueños y metas era tener su propia tienda hizo todo lo posible para ahorrar dinero y comprar poco a poco las vitrinas y víveres para la tienda. 

En la actualidad ella ya tiene su propia tienda en la que vende bebidas, enlatados, granos etc. Ella trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 22:00 pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres y bebidas para su tienda y así que este más surtida. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y comprar una camioneta para la movilización de la mercadería de su tienda.
texts.en:
Vilma V. is 35 years old. She lives in a suburban zone in the Perimeter of Guayaquil (the area where she lives is very close to the estuary of the Perimeter). She owns a cement house that has all the basic services. She is divorced but has two children who are 7 and 4 years old and who study at the public schools. Vilma began selling vegetables in the area near her house but one of her dreams and goals was to have her own shop. She did everything possible to save money and gradually buy the display cases and food for the shop. Currently, she has her own shop from which she sells drinks, canned goods, grains, etc. She works from 6AM until 10PM every day. With the loan, she wants to buy vegetables and drinks for her store so that it's better stocked. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and buy a wagon to transport her shop's merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables, drinks.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu T. is married with six children, all of whom are attending school. She started her business from funds she got from her husband and has been in business for the past fourteen years.

Knowing fully well that the sale of foodstuffs is lucrative, Mariatu has decided to maintain the same business but this time round wants to buy more stock. Hence she is in dire need of a loan to be able to buy more stock in large quantities.

With the proceeds from the loan, Mariatu intends to educate her children and construct a dwelling house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Benita Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Benita Lorena R. S. es soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo vive en el barrio la florida junto a su familia, tiene su negocio de venta comida en el mercado Bisne contiguo al boulevard desde hace diez años.
La señora Benita Lorena R. S. tiene dos años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado trece créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, todos los créditos anteriores, le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio y realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y en el negocio, el crédito actual  lo quiere para invertir en el negocio y seguir trabajando, para mantener a su familia ya que es el único ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
Benita Lorena R. S. is single, has two children, and lives in the neighborhood of La Florida with her family. She has had a business selling food in the Bisne market next to the boulevard for the past ten years.

Benita Lorena R. S. has been working for two years using loans and has repaid thirteen loans on time and shown responsibility with all of her pasts loans which have helped her to maintain a stable business and make improvements to her home and business. She will invest the current loan in her business and keep working in order to take care of her family since she is their one source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other products

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 36-year-old mother of four. She has a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking fat and maize flour among other products. She has been in this business for six years and her business has grown since she joined Faulu Kenya.

Angelina belongs to a group of entrepreneurs who save their money together and guarantee each other's loans. This makes it easier for her to get a loan from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to add to her stock of sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

Angelina is a hardworking lady who hopes to have a well-established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celsa Arelis

texts.es:
La señora Celsa Arelis B., trabaja por cuenta propia se dedica a la venta de refrescos en la terminal de buses del bisne, es soltera habita en barrio Divino Niño tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. 

La señora Arelis B. solicita crédito con CEPRODEL desde hace seis años y siempre ha pagado en tiempo y forma, lo utiliza para la compra de productos envasados como gaseosas, jugos, aguas purificadas,  etc.
texts.en:
Celsa Arelis B. is self-employed; she sells soft-drinks at the El Bisne bus terminal. She is single and lives in the Divino Niño neighborhood with her two, school-age children. Mrs. Arelis B. has had CEPRODEL loans for the last 6 years and she has always repaid in a timely fashion. She will use this new funding to buy packaged items like: soft-drinks, juices, purified water, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudia Gisel

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Gisel T. vive acompañada, tiene dos hijos a su cargo vive en el barrio san Agustín junto a su familia, tiene su negocio de venta comida  rápida en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. Ademan de su negocio trabaja en la alcaldía municipal como operaria de limpieza.

 La señora Claudia Gisel T. tiene tres años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado diecinueve créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio e ir evolucionando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Gisel T. lives with her life partner and has two children under her care. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood with her family. She has sold fast food in her home for the last 2 years. In addition, she is employed as a municipal cleaning lady. She has managed loans for three years and has always repaid in a timely fashion. She used her previous loans to maintain her business stability and to evolve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Felipa Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Mercedes T. es soltera, tiene tres hijos pertenece a la iglesia de los testigos de Jehova vive con su familia en barrio el Rosario cine nela 3c. Arriba ½ c. al norte.
La señora Felipa T. vende flores artificiales de diferentes colores, jarrones, almohadas y chinelas  tienes más de treinta y cinco años de vender en el mercado el bisne y cuando mas surte su negocio es para diciembre para celebración de la purísima concepción de María.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felipa Mercedes T. is single and has three children; she is a Jehovah’s Witness and lives with her family in Rosario neighborhood, 3 blocks up and ½ block north of Cine Nela. Mrs. Felipa T. sells assorted artificial flowers, pots, pillows and bedspreads; he has been in business in the El Bisne market for over 35 years. December is when she stocks the most merchandise for the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: artificial flowers, pillows, etc.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 47 years old and is married with three children who go to school.

Teresia runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years and has one employee. Her customers are mostly area residents and commuters. She was previously distributing eggs in Nairobi before she ventured into this business.

Since Teresia joined Faulu Kenya she is able to access loans and her business has grown. She wants to attract more customers to her cafeteria and therefore she has requested a loan of Kes 35,000 from Faulu Kenya to renovate her premises and to add to her stock of cooking ingredients.

Teresia hopes to grow her business and stabilize her income in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients and to renovate her business premises

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en: Mohamed Alie K. is single and started business with a very small amount of money he acquired from his mother. Being that he was very determined to become a successful businessman, he was able to double his initial capital and left the sale of  postal cards and cosmetic items to begin the sale of mobile phone accessories and clothing. With an experience of 6 years in business, Mohamed  is therefore seeking a loan. He intends to construct a house in the future and start his own family with proceeds from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories and clothing for resale

loans.name: Levenent

texts.en:
Levenent is an industrious married father of two. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, rice, cooking fat and cereals. He has been in the business for seven years and has two employees.   He also rents his residential houses to earn extra income.  He is in a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya called Amahesa who meet on weekly basis to save their money.  

Levenent has previously taken out a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to expand his business, and he successfully repaid it.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of rice, sugar and cereals and also to build more houses to rent out.  He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To add to his inventory of rice, sugar, and cereals and build more houses to rent.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
EL SR. OSCAR ESTA CASADO, SU DOMICILIO ESTA UBICADO EN  EL MUNICIPIO DE LA GUARDIA, LOCALIDAD DE BASILIO, DISTANTE A 53 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA AGRICULTURA , SIEMBRA DE SESAMO, SORGO, SU ESPOSA LA SRA. JUANA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES VACUNOS,  TIENE 4 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR LOS CUALES CAMINAS VARIOS KILOMETROS PARA ASISTIR A LA LA ESCUELA, YA QUE EN EL AREA RURAL LAS ESCUELAS SON POCAS Y ALEJADAS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA HACERLE EL MANTENIMIENTO A SU SEMBRADIO DE SESAMO YA QUE ESTE AÑO SE LE HA LLENADO DE PLAGAS, COMO NINGUN OTRO, EL SE SIENTE SATISFECHO POR EL APOYO FINANCIERO QUE LA INSTITUCION LE ESTA BRINDANDO, YA QUE EN EL AREA RURAL SON POCAS LAS INSTITUCIONES QUE ATIENDEN ESTOS CREDITOS.

OJO. EL SR. OSCAR APARECE EN LA FOTO JUNTO A SU ESPOSA LA SRA. JUANA.
texts.en:
Oscar is married. He lives in La Guardia, Basilio, 53 kilometers from Santa Cruz. He is a sorghum and sesame farmer. His wife, Juana, raises cattle. They have 4 school-age children who must walk several kilometers to school because schools are few and far between in rural areas. He will use the requested funds to service his sesame crop because this year it has become infested by pests like never before. He is satisfied with the help the institution is providing because there are few institutions in rural areas that offer this kind of loans. NOTE: Oscar appears in the photo next to his wife, Juana.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: EL SR. ROBERTO  NACIO EL 30 DE AGOSTO DE 1980 TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON DOÑA SEBASTIANA CON 1 HIJO QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR, HACE 11 AÑOS QUE VIVE EN SANTO CORAZON CERCA DE LA PROVINCIA EL TORNO, TIENE SU PROPIA PARCELA , EL TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA SIEMBRA PAPA, MAIZ, MANI, Y OTROS PRODUCTOS. DON ROBERTO HACE 6 AÑOS QUE VIENE TRABAJANDO CON EMPRENDER ES UN CLIENTE ANTIGUO QUE TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION Y DESEA SALIR ADELANTE PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIVA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Roberto was born on 30 August 1980; he is 30 years old. He’s married to Sebastiana and they have a school-age son. He has lived in Santo Corazón, near Torno province, for the last 11 years; he has his own farmlands where he grows potato, corn, peanuts and other products. Roberto has collaborated with Emprender for the last 6 years; he is a long-standing client with much desire for self-improvement and for success so that he can improve his entire family’s quality of life. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farm supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with two children in school.   She mines building stones in her quarry to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years and has two employees.  She also practices farming to earn enough money to support her family since she is the breadwinner.   She is in a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya called Kwale where she saves her money, hence enabling her to borrow loans.  She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to finance the entire quarry activity.   She hopes to own more quarry sites and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To finance quarrying activities

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school.    She runs a retail shop where she sells auto spare parts to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has one employee.   She was previously employed before she started this business.   She has joined a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya who are willing and determined to improve their lives. They meet on a weekly basis to save their money and later on the group guarantees its members a loan.  She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of spare parts.  She hopes to grow her business and stabilize her income in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 28-year-old married lady who has one child.  She has been running a salon for three years.  She is a member of Faulu Kenya under the group 'Turbo Investor' who support her in case she takes a loan.  She wants to buy hair products to add to the inventory in her salon.  Therefore, she has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open up other salons in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 30-year-old married man who sells women’s clothes. He also earns extra income from sugarcane farming.

Victor is a member of Faulu Kenya and belongs to a group called JC Bravos whose members meet weekly to save their money. The members become guarantors in case a member defaults on a loan. In this way, Victor can easily access a loan from Faulu Kenya.

Victor has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more dresses to sell. He hopes to buy more stalls for selling clothes. He dreams of selling clothes wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy more dresses to sell

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 36-year-old married man who runs a transport business to earn a living. The competition is high but he has many customers because he has been in the industry for sixteen years.

Titus saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya which guarantees him loans. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

Titus hopes to buy several motorcycles for his transport business in ten years time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 35 years old and is married. He runs a photography and video coverage business where he produces videos and photographs to earn a living. He has been in the business for fourteen years and has two employees. He also sells stationery to increase his earnings.

Josphat belongs to a young group of entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy an instant photo machine. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy an instant photo machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jaime de Jesús D. es casado tiene cuatro hijos tres de ellos en  edad escolar vive con su familia en el reparto divino niño, trabaja en la alcaldía desempeñándose como vigilante en el mercadon, hace más de once años.
El señor Jaime de Jesús D. es cliente de esta institución desde hace cinco años ha cancelado dos créditos en tiempo y forma los que utilizo para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jaime de Jesús D. is married and has four children, three of whom are school-aged. He lives with his family in Reparto Divino Niño. He has worked for more then eleven years as a security guard at the Mercadon City Hall. Mr. D. has been a client of ours for five years. He's paid off two loans, which he used for home improvements, on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (zinc, planks, and nails).

loans.name: Yon Cherling

texts.es:
Yon tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus tios en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida vendiendo verduras y frutas desde hace mas de un año en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe, el ofrece todo tipo de productos frescos a sus clientes. Como esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos económicos, el trata de ofrecer productos de buena calidad y un trato amable a sus clientes para poder mantener su negocio.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y la demanda por los productos que ofrece ha ido aumentando, por este motivo el desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas verduras y frutas, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yon es un joven bastante trabajador y muy resposable, su mayor anhelo es poder tener un puesto mas grande dentro del mercado. Las personas que lo conocen le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Yon is 26 years old. He is single, and he lives with his aunt and uncle in the Guadalupe district. This district is in a coastal region that belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region. It is located one hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over one year he has been earning a living selling vegetables and fruits outside of the market in the city of Guadalupe. He sells all types of fresh products to his customers. As this is the only activity that provides him with economic income, he tries to offer good quality products and good customer service in order to be able to maintain his business. His business has been growing, and the demand for the products he sells has been increasing. Therefore, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables.
