That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,500 PEN. This is to help him achieve his objective. Yon is a very hard working young man, and he is very responsible. His greatest goal is to be able to have a larger stand inside of the market. The people who know him hold him in high esteem, and they consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetable to expand his business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana Francisca M. A. es soltera, tiene tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega y se dedica a la venta de repostería, esta repostería ella la compra en una panadería por cantidades y luego sale a vender por las calles del barrio.

Sus hijos también le ayudan económicamente pero a ella le gusta el trabajo para tener su propio dinero, lleva ya seis años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha sido muy cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca M. A. is single; she has three children but none are still dependent on her. She lives in Camilo Ortega neighborhood and she sells pastries that she buys at wholesale from a bakery; she then resells them along the streets of her neighborhood. Her children help her out financially but she likes to work to earn her own money. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 6 years and she has always repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastries.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria A. B. tiene la edad de 37 años, vive en el barrio Medardo Andino, es casada y su esposo es chofer, y le apoya económicamente a los gastos que la familia tiene mensualmente, ella trabaja como conserje desde hace 3 años, ellos son una familia humilde y sus ingresos mensuales son bastante limitados.

Una de las necesidades que tiene la familia es mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura del hogar, pero sus limitaciones económicas no le permiten llevar a cabo este proyecto, motivo por el cual solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y remodelar de esta manera toda su humilde morada, este apoyo les ayudara  a ellos dos, ha habitar en un espacio más cómodo y seguro,  gracias a esto mejoraran sus condiciones económicas-sociales
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino barrio in Managua, Nicaragua. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver, and they support each other to cover the family's monthly expenses. Juana has worked as a caretaker for the past three years. This is a humble family, and their monthly income is quite limited. One of the family's biggest necessities is to improve their home's infrastructure, but their limited economic resources haven't allowed them to take up this project, which is why they are requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to remodel their humble home. This support will help both Juana and her husband, giving them a more comfortable and secure dwelling and improve their socio-economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel home

loans.name: Las Pascuas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es: Doña Vicenta X. es la presidenta D. este grupo D. personas ella tiene 6 hijos 4 varones y 2 mujeres ella cuenta con una tienda D. articulos D. consumo diario, vive a unos 20 kilometros D. la ciudad D. Momostenango, actualmente ella se dedica tambien a la confeccion D. ropa, tales como Pants, Sudaderos, Faldas para señoritas, y cuenta con animales domesticos, ella en lo particular necesita un crédito para la compra D. materia prima del trabajo que realiza, la cual para poder obtener dicho prestamo acudio a la Asociación ASDIR, para que se le pueda apoyar con el financiamiento, asi también en su mayoria del grupo se dedican a la confección D. prendas.
texts.en:
Vicenta X. is the president of this group. She has six kids, four boys and two girls, and runs a grocery store. She lives 20 kilometers from the city of Momostenango and also currently makes a living making clothing such as pants, sweatshirts and skirts for women. Vincenta in particular needs a loan to purchase the supplies she needs to carry out her work, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to support her with the financing. The majority of the group members also make a living in dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: William Alejandro

texts.es:
William Z. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene una casa de cemento si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa es arquitecta ellos tienen un hijo de 7 meses. 

William inicio como empleado en una micro empresa de químicos pero uno de sus sueños era tener su propia empresa decidió empezar su propio negocio con los conocimientos aprendidos en químicos. 

Ahora William tiene su propio negocio de químicos en su casa. El hace desinfectantes, cloro y otros químicos para vender. Trabaja desde las 06h00 am elaborando y vendiendo los químicos para sus clientes. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar botellas, desinfectantes y un triciclo para vender más en su sector por donde vive. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local en el centro de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
William Z. is 25 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He lives in a cement house that has all basic services. His wife is an architect, and together they have a 7-month-old son. Williams started out working at a small chemical business, but one of his dreams was to have his own business, so he decide to start one with the knowledge he learned from working with chemicals. Now William runs his own chemical business out of his home. He makes disinfectants, chlorine and other chemical products to sell. He works from 6 a.m. onward making and selling the chemicals for customers. One of the problems he has encountered is the crime in his area. With the loan, he plans to purchase bottles, disinfectants and a motorbike so he can sell more products throughout the area he lives. In the future, he wants to have his own store in the center of Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottles, disinfectants and a motorbike

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es un padre D. familia D. 43 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposa y al menor D. sus hijos D. cuatro años D. edad en el sector Nueva Jerusalen del distrito D. San Gregorio, en L. provincia D. San Miguel, región Cajamarca; una región ubicada en L. serranía del país, sus actividades principales son L. agricultura y L. minería.

Se dedica a L. agricultura desD. que era muy joven, empezó trabajando como peón agrícoL. en los campos D. cultivo cercanos y poco a poco pudo ahorrar el dinero suficiente para adquirir su terreno propio. Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, el cultivo tiene quince dias D. sembrado y Gerardo desea trabajar arduamente para que este producto D. una buena produccción que le permita agenciarse D. los recursos necesarios con los cuales pueda sostener a su familia.

Su cultivo está siendo invadido por maleza y el desea realizar actividades D. limpieza D. terreno para que esta dificultad no perjudique el correcto desarrollo D. su cultivo, por ello se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piena utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Gerardo es una persona muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es otorgarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que lo conocen siempre acuden a el cuando necesitan ayuda ya que lo consideran una persona D. confianza.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a 43-year-old father who lives together with his wife and his youngest child, age 4, in the Nueva Jerusalen sector of the San Gregorio district, in San Miguel province, Cajamarca region. This region is located in the highlands of the country, where the main economic activities are agriculture and mining. Gerardo has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He began working as an agricultural laborer on the farms near his home, and he was gradually able to save up enough money to acquire his own land. He is currently growing corn, which he planted 15 days ago. Gerardo is determined to work hard in order to reap a good harvest from this crop, which will allow him to obtain the necessary resources to support his family. His fields are being invaded by weeds and brush, and he wants to carry out some land clearing work so that this problem will not affect his crop. Because of this, he has seen the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, for 2000 Peruvian new soles. He plans to use the funds to achieve this objective. Gerardo is a person who is very devoted to his family and to his work. His greatest desire is to proviD. his family with a better quality of life. Those who know him always turn to him when they need help, because they consider him a reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance expenses for his corn fields

location.town: Nueva Jerusalen - San Gregorio - San Miguel - Caja

loans.name: Zobeida Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Zobeida del Socorro M. M. tiene 27 años es soltera y habta en el Barrio de la Borgoña, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años.

Uno de sus prioridades a futuro está la remodelación de su casa de habitación. Dentro de los principales problemas que han tenido las tierras esta la sequia y el ataque de plagas que amenaza con la producción de la piña, razón por la cual solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos para la siembra así como también fungicidas o plaguicidas, estos materiales garantizaran una cosecha de buena calidad que le permita mejores condiciones financieras para la inversión de nuevos proyectos de vida que les favorezcan económico-socialmente.
texts.en:
Zobeida del Socorro M. M. is 27 years old and single. She lives in the Borgoña neighborhood, and she has worked in agriculture for the past 5 years. One of her priorities for the future is remodeling the house where she lives. Among the main problems she has faced have been drought and attacks of pests which threaten her pineapple crop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy cuttings for planting as well as fungicides or other pest control preparations. These will ensure a good-quality harvest, improving her financial situation and allowing her to invest in new projects which will help her socio-economically.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cuttings for planting and fungicides or pest control preparations

loans.name: Jackeline Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Jackeline del Rosario B. Z., tiene 28 años de edad es casada y su esposo es mecánico, ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños y que dependen económicamente de ellos, ellos habitan en el Barrio Los Martinez.

Los planes de la familia son las mejorías continuas a su hogar, para el bienestar de sus hijos, pero uno de los principales problemas que los agobian continuamente, es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a su comunidad, ellos tienen un pequeño taller mecánico y dentro de los planes esta la remodelación de su negocio,  es por esta razón que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra  de materiales de construcción, que favorezcan las comodidades del negocio a prestar mejores condiciones para su clientela, esto apoyara económicamente a los ingresos de la familia favoreciendo las condiciones para futuros proyectos familiares, asi mismo la recuperación de sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Jackeline del Rosario B. Z. is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic and they have three dependent children. The family lives in the Los Martinez neighborhood. The family plans to make continual improvements to their home for the well-being of their children. One of the persistent problems that they face is a lack of potable water in their community. They have a small automotive repair business and among their plans is to remodel their shop. They will use this loan to purchase the necessary construction materials to make their shop more comfortable so they can offer better service to their customers. This will increase the family's economic resources which will support their plans for future projects and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of their business

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
Julia F. R., tiene 50 años de edad y vive en el barrio  el milagro  de  la ciudad de Cartagena,  con su  esposo y 4  hijos  en las  edades  de 24, 30  años; En esta comunidad tiene un negocio  llamado variedades Sandy, allí vende todo tipo de mercancías como pantalones  jeans, sabanas, toallas, camisa de colegios y blusas de contado, aunque también tiene unos clientes con los que trabaja a crédito. Justamente para este negocio julia solicita a la fundación financiamiento por valor de $2.300.000, para comprar mercancías como jeans, sabanas, toallas, camisa  de colegios, blusas, a solicitud de los clientes que tiene en diversos barrios de la ciudad. 
Julia desarrolló su capacidad emprendedora desde cuando tenía una tienda con su esposo,  considerado por ella un buen negocio pero muy esclavizante, monótono y no acorde con su estilo de vida, ya que  ella soñaba con uno diferente, menos rutinario e innovador y donde sus hijas participaran como lo hacen ahora en  Variedades Sandy, por eso siente su actividad actual como su mas grande acierto. Cuando decidieron vender la tienda, se quedaron solo con dos vitrinas  y  un capital que fue  invertido en mercancías económicas acorde a su sector objeto;  este negocio empezó a funcionar muy bien y fue así como a través de una amiga que le recomendó a la   Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  encontró  la oportunidad de obtener un capital con bajos intereses, con él  compró mercancía para ampliar su negocio; su primer crédito fue en grupo y por un monto de $300.000; allí  recibió capacitación con la cual aprendió el manejo del negocio  para lograr lo que hoy es,   “su sueño hecho realidad”   en la actualidad tiene un crédito individual, pero ha recibido 14, con estos financiamientos ha logrado desarrollar su negocio y darle educación a su hijos que están estudiando en la universidad diseño de modas y administración respectivamente; al mismo tiempo sus hijas trabajan con ella y son el trío fantástico, cada una   en su quehacer y entre las tres contribuyen al éxito del mismo. Julia quiere proyectar su negocio a nuevas plazas, y se siente muy feliz con él, pues con sus utilidades  ha logrado construir tres apartamentos, en uno de ellos   vive su familia, y los otros dos se encuentran arrendados lo cual representa un ingreso adicional.  También  el local donde se encuentra su negocio, que al principio se encontraba en  la sala de su casa, es producto del éxito que ha tenido trabajando en su microempresa, y esto es generado por  la unión familiar y el trabajo conjunto dirigido a la misma actividad y con metas únicas familiares.   Julia está  muy agradecida con la Fundación porque creyó en ellos y porque ha ayudado a generar un  impacto positivo,  en la ecuación de sus hijos; es importante resaltar que ellos hoy son socios de variedades Sandy, y se sienten orgullosos de sus padres y de los esfuerzos que realizaron para lograr lo que un día inicio muy pequeño; así mismo la comunidad  reconoce y respalda este negocio  pues saben que variedades Sandy cumple un papel importante en la sociedad y es que ahí todo lo encuentran.
texts.en:
Julia F. R. is 50 years old and lives in the Milagro neighborhood in the city of Cartagena with her husband and 4 children aging from 24 to 30 years old. It is in this community that she has a business called Variedades Sandy where she sells all types of goods such as trousers, jeans, sheets, towels, school shirts and blouses for cash, although she also has some customers that she gives credit to. It is for this business that Julia is asking the financial foundation for $2.300.000, to buy goods such as jeans, sheets, towels, school shirts, blouses, at the request of the customers that she has in various neighborhoods of the city. Julia has been developing her entrepreneurial ability every since she had a shop with her husband, which she considered to be a good business but very time-consuming,monotonous and which did not agree with her lifestyle. She used to dream of something different, less routine and innovative and where her daughters participate as they do now at Variedades Sandy, therefore she feels her current business is a better decision. When they decided to sell the shop they were left with only two display cabinets and capital that was invested in economic goods in line with their goal sector. This business started to progress very well and it was through a friend who recommended the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation where she found the opportunity to get low interest capital, with which she bought goods to expand her business. Her first loan was in a group and for a total of $300.000. There she received training in business management to achieve what is today “her dream become reality”. Currently she has an individual loan, but she has received 14 and with these finances she has managed to develop her business and give her children an education - they are studying at university, fashion design and administration respectively; and at the same time her daughters work with her and they are the fantastic trio, each one in their own work and between the three of them they contribute to each others' sucess. Julia wants to project her business into new areas, and feels very happy with it. With her profits she has managed to build three apartments, she lives in one of them with her family, and the other two she rents which gives her additional income. Also her business premises, which was at first in the living room of her home, is a product of the success that she has had working in her micro enterprise, and this is generated by the family union and the collective work directed towards the same activity and with unique family goals. Julia is very grateful to the Foundation because they believed in them and because they helped to generate a positive impact for her children; it is important to point out that today they are partners of Variedades Sandy, and they feel proud of their parents and of the efforts that they made to achieve something that started out very small; as well the community acknowledges and supports this business as they know that Variedades Sandy fulfils an important role in society and it is there you find everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods such as jeans, sheets, towels, school shirts and blouses

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara del Carmen B. R., tiene la edad de 39, es acompañada de su compañero de vida el cual labora como jardinero, ellos con sus 4 hijos, habitan en un peligroso Barrio de Managua el cual lleva por nombre Laureles Sur.

Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de ampliaciones y enmarcaciones de fotos, y  de sus máximas necesidades están las remodelaciones en  su hogar, debido a que sus hijos están demandándole mejores condiciones independiente, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para uso del hijo mayor, esto le permitirá optimas condiciones para que sus hijos habiten en comodidad. Y la tranquilidad personal de ofrecer un buen ambiente familiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen B. R. is 39 years old and is accompanied by her life partner, who works as a gardener. Together with their 4 children, they live in a dangerous neighborhood of Managua, called Laureles Sur. Xiomara's work is enlarging and framing photographs. One of her greatest needs is remodeling her home, since her children are asking her for better living conditions and more space for themselves. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to construct a room for the use of her oldest son. This will be an optimal solution that will allow her children to live more comfortably, and Xiomara will be content in the knowledge that she is providing a good environment for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing an additional room

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en una combi que cubre la ruta que une las ciudades de Guadalupe, Chepén y Pueblo Nuevo. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos económicos los cuales utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el apoyo a la economía de su familia.

Cesar es consciente de que la vida de sus usuarios depende de la responsabilidad con la que realice su trabajo, por eso el desea mantener en regla todos los documentos que garanticen la seguridad de sus clientes, tal es el caso del SOAT que es un seguro que cubre el tratamiento de sus clientes ante un eventual accidente, el desea renovarlo este año y para ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is single, 21 years old, and lives with his parents in the district of Guadalupe, a coastal district that pertains to the Pacasmayo province, in the region of La Libertad, about an hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past year, he has been offering transportation services with his van to passengers traveling between the cities of Guadalupe, Chepen, and Pueblo Nuevo. This business is his only form of income, which he uses to cover his personal expenses and to help support his family. Cesar is aware that his passengers rely heavily on him and the responsibility of his work. As such, he hopes to keep all of the documents that guarantee the safety and the security of his clients in order. For example, the SOAT, which is an insurance that covers all medical treatments for his passengers in case of an accident. He hopes to renew it this year and that is why he is applying, for the first time, for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 soles that would be used towards this expense. Cesar is a very responsible and hard working individual. His main goal is to keep growing as a business man and to be able to offer his parents a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of insurance in order to offer public transportation services.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, es una mujer muy servicial y laboriosa, tiene 44 años, hace 7 años que enviudó, de aquel matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos, solo dos de ellos viven con ella en su casa propia. Cuando perdió a su esposo, cogió fuerzas para continuar trabajando por sus hijos, siendo la  única persona que debe velar por ellos. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a plantar todos los productos oriundos de la selva peruana, ahora realiza el trabajo con ayuda de sus hijos y vecinos. Ella está acostumbrada a los trabajos agrícolas y gracias a este oficio que tiene una acogedora vivienda, además que puede brindarles a sus hijos un adecuado bienestar y educación. Es por eso que desea extender sus plantaciones con frutas cítricas y paltas, ya que tiene un terreno de 8 hectáreas,  y al que todavía le falta prepararlo. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, manifiesta además que le agrada mucho trabajar en su grupo comunal, por estar integrados por personas que impulsen el respeto y la responsabilidad en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará veinte sacos de fertilizantes, mil plantas de plátanos, de esa manera pueda renovar sus cultivos, asimismo poder contratar operarios para que ayuden con esta labor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and a hard working and helpful woman. She became a widow 7 years ago and has 4 children, but only two of which live with her in her own house. When her husband died, she had to continue working in order to support her children, being the only person that could watch over them. Since she was 24 years old, she has cultivated all types of native plants from the Peruvian jungle. She continues to do the same but with the help of her children and neighbors. She is accustomed to agricultural jobs and is thankful for this profession because it has provided her with cozy housing and the ability to provide her children with a decent livelihood and education. For this reason, she hopes to expand her cultivations with citric fruits and avocados. She currently has a terrain of 8 hectares, which she still doesn't have completely prepared. This is her 7th credit with MFP, and has demonstrated that she appreciates working with her communal group because it is composed of people that promote respect and responsibility in the group. With the loan that she is applying for, she plans to buy twenty sacks of fertilizers and a thousand banana plants, with which she will be able to renovate her cultivations, and also be able to contract workers to help with the process.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a thousand banana plants, twenty sacks of fertilizer, and contract workers.

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Sacllo está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los antiguos Inkas, Sacllo se caracteriza por tener zonas agrícolas y ganaderas, Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo, el banco comunal está conformado por 11 mujeres y 2 varones que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las comunidad de Sacllo. Las actividades económicas de los socias a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de frutas, venta de chicha, venta de leche, venta de golosinas y venta de animales menores y un socio brinda servicio de docencia.  Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Basilia forma parte del banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Basilia nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos si ayuda de su pareja. Basilia se dedica a la venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores y venta de chicha de jora. Basilia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores y semillas.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Sacllo is located in the district and province of Calca, within the Cusco department, in the heart of the sacred valley that was once occupied by the Incas. Sacllo is known for having many agricultural and livestock farms. Several years ago, a group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank, "Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo," which is currently in its 6th cycle. This communal bank is composed of 11 women and 2 men, all of whom are workers and business owners that are always looking for opportunities to move ahead and whom dedicate their daily hard work to being able to give their children a better future. It is a communal bank made up of members that live within the community of Sacllo. The following are some of the economic sectors that the members work in: the sale of vegetables, grocery items, fruits, chicha, milk, sweets, and baby animals, and one member provides teaching services. Cusco is known for being a charming city located in the Southern Region of Peru. It is popular for its archaeological monuments, its historical city center, its landscapes, and its history. Basilia is a part of the communal bank, "Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo." She is a single mother of three children. She tells us, with great pride, that she is able to provide her children with a brighter future without the help of her partner. Basilia sells vegetables and chicha, and works in the rearing of baby animals. She needs a loan so that she can purchase more baby animals and seeds. The members of her bank are thankful for the granted opportunity and they promise to fulfill the loan payments by the designated deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basilia plans to use the loan to purchase more baby animals and seeds.

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año y medio a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, este negocio le provee de ingresos con los que ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia, ya que su esposo está inválido y la pensión que percibe no le basta para solventar los gastos familiares.

Su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida ya que ella trata siempre de ofrecer productos de buena calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes. Sus esfuerzos están teniendo resultados y la demanda está creciendo, por ello se ha propuesto ampliar el negocio con la compra de mas productos de primera necesidad y para lograrlo esta solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles.

Julia es una mujer bastante entragada a su trabajo y que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante y brindarle a su esposo una mejor calidadde vida.
texts.en:
Julia is the mother of a family who lives with her husband and daughter in the district of Guadalupe. Guadalupe is a costal area in the Pascasmayuo province, in the region of La Libertad, which is located an hour and ten minutes from the city of Ciclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For a year and a half she has made a living selling groceries and basic goods from a bodega set up in her home. This business provides an income to help her support her family since her husband is disabled and the pension he receives does not cover the family's bills. Her business is doing well because she always tries to offer good quality products and she treats her customers well. Her efforts are getting results and demand is increasing, therefore she has decided to expand her business by increasing her stock of basic goods. In order to do this she is taking out her first loan of 1000 soles from "Edpyme Alternativa." Julia is a woman who is very dedicated to her business and is always looking for a way to help her family get ahead. Her greatest desire is to keep helping her family get ahead and offer her husband a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic goods to expand business

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. G. es una persona muy  trabajadora que con esfuerzo fue haciendo un patrimonio para su familia, la vivienda que el tiene necesita algunos arreglos por fuera; como  enjarre en la paredes y pintura para que se vea presentable. Pues como se observa en la imagen la fachada de la casa ya se ve muy deteriorada a cauda de la lluvia hay algunas partes blancas y comenta que se ve mal y es por ello que quiere el préstamo para cambiar el aspecto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesús R. G. is a very hard-working person. With effort he has been making a legacy for his family. The house that he has needs some repairs on the outside. For example, it needs plaster on the walls and paint in order to look presentable. As can be seen in the photo, the house’s appearance is much deteriorated. Because of the rain, some parts are white. He says that it looks very bad. That is why he wants the loan to change the appearance of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster and paint his house

loans.name: Lener Alexander

texts.es:
El Joven Lener Alexander R. S. trabaja por cuenta propia con un triciclo con el cual transporta clientes por las calles de Chinandega, el tiene ya tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y ha sido excelente cliente.
Solicito crédito para realizar reparaciones de su medio de trabajo como llantas y reparaciones de rayos, para mantener su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Laner Alexander R. S. is self-employed; he provides public transportation services with his three-wheel vehicle along Chinandega’s streets. He has been an excellent CEPRODEL client for three years now. He requested funds to buy tires and repair wheel spokes on his vehicle in order to keep his source of income operating properly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Chicken and meat

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo Antonio C. es soltero tiene un hijo menor vive en la florida del restaurante la terraza 1c al norte ½ c. abajo de profesión, contador público, actualmente trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad en la Alcaldía de Chinandega.
  El señor Leonardo Antonio C. ha tenido tres créditos de los cuales ha cancelado dos crédito demostrando ser una persona responsable, el señor C. solicito el Crédito para ayudar a su mama en gastos personales.
texts.en:
Leonardo Antonio C. is single and has a minor son. He lives in La Florida, one block north and ½-block below La Terraza restaurant. He is a public accountant employed as an accounting assistant for the city of Chinandega. He has had three previous loans that he has repaid in a timely fashion. He requested funds to help his mother with some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help his mother pay for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa.
El señor Daniel B. S. quien es empleado de una compañía muy importante en México donde se distribuye de pan. El siempre piensa en darles una mejora calidad a sus dos hijos menores a los cuales quiere brindarles un patrimonio. Hace tiempo adquirió un vivienda de interés social a la quiere ir haciéndole mejoras. El crédito lo necesita para poner piso firme en el patio de atrás para que en temporada de lluvia no se estanque el agua sucia y sus hijos puedan tomar una enfermedad infecciosa.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is his wife. Daniel B. S. is employed by a very important company in Mexico. It distributes bread. He always plans on giving a better quality of life to his two minor children. He wants to give them a legacy. A while ago he got a house through social services, and he wants to make some improvements. He needs the loan to put down a solid floor on the back patio. During the rainy season there is a lot of dirty water, and his children may get an infectious disease.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down a solid floor on the back patio

loans.name: Silvia Cristina

texts.es: Silvia Cristina R. C. quiere terminar una barda que por falta de capital no ha podido levantar, ella es madre de 3 niños a los cuales quiere darles protección pues como esta la situación no quiere que a sus hijos les pase algo. Silvia y su esposo son maestros de primaria ya que es la manera de cómo obtienen ingresos, para poder  ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia Cristina R. C. wants to finish a cement wall (fence) that she has not been able to put tup due to lack of money. She is the mother of three children she would like to provide protection for. With the situation the way it is now, well, she doesn't want anything to happen to her kids. Silvia and her husband are elementary school teachers; this is how they make a living to provide their children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put up a cement wall (fence)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Raising the roof on his home.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es el esposo de María Isabel.
María Isabel es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que desde hace 8 años tiene una venta de gorditas junto con su esposo que la apoya en cada proyecto que ella tiene. En este momento ella necesita comprar piso cerámico para ponerlo en un cuarto que construyo con prestamos de esta institución en el que agradece por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the picture is María Isabel's husband. María Isabel is a very enterprising woman since she has been selling gorditas (small, thick, corn flour tortillas) for eight years alongside her husband who supports every project she has. Right now she needs to buy a ceramic floor to install in a room she built with loan money from this institution, that she thanks for the support they have given to her.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a ceramic floor

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever tiene 24 años, convive con Guísela de 17 años, de cuya relación tiene una pequeña niña de 2 años, y juntos viven en su casa propia, hecho de material rústico. Desde hace 10 años a él le gusta trabajar en sus cultivos de frutas cítricas, palta y plátanos, que con esmero y dedicación procura que sus cosechas sean muy productivas, además cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, puesto que esta labor requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Por otro lado, trabaja como operario en sus días libres, ganando S/.20.00  soles diarios, ganancias que le alcanza para  solventar sus gastos domésticos e incluso le facilita ahorrar para cualquier eventualidad futura. En lo sucesivo desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, que le generen una mayor producción y por ende pueda ganar más, para que así pueda darle una buena educación a su hija. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, considera además que desea continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal,  por que esta integrado por personas muy buenas y responsables, que comparten entre sí sus logros y decepciones. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de plátano, además arrendará un terreno para renovar sus plantaciones de naranjas y mandarinas.
texts.en:
Ever is 24, and he lives with 17 year old Guísela. They have a two year old daughter. They live together in their own house, which is made of rustic material. For ten years he has liked working with his citrus fruit, avocado, and banana crops. With care and dedication he tries to makes sure that his harvests are productive. Given that this work requires much effort, his wife helps him. He is employed as a worker on his days off, and he earns S/.20.00 soles a day. These earnings pay for the household expenses, and they provide savings for whatever may happen in the future. In the future he wishes to buy more farming land, which would generate greater production. Then he would earn more in order to be able to give his daughter a good education. This is his third loan with MFP. He wants to continue working with his communal bank group because it is made up of very good and responsible people. They share their achievements and disappointments with each other. He will use the 1,500 soles that he has requested to buy dozens of banana plants. He will also rent a piece of land to renew his orange and tangerine plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dozens of banana plants and rent a piece of land to renew his orange and tangerine plants

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es: Blanca Esthela es una mujer joven que tiene muchos proyectos para apoyar  su esposo para ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar. Ella cuenta con negocio de la venta de gorditas y platillos los cuales ofrece en las maquiladoras por pedido. Ahora a ella le esta ofreciendo una carrucha  para adaptar a la  su camioneta en la que le puede poner un anuncio ofreciendo el producto y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Blancha Esthela is a young woman who has a lot of projects so that she can support her husband and help him with household expenses. She has a business selling gorditas (a typical Mexican dish) and meals ordered by workers in assembly plants. Now she is being offered a cart that can be attached to her pickup truck. She will put a sign on this offering her products and, thus, obtain more income

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cart for her business.

loans.name: Norma Erendira

texts.es: La señora Norma Erendira A. se dedica a la venta de herramientas usadas en una pulga conocida de la ciudad. Con este negocio ya tiene un año de ofrecer este tipo de mercancía, pero ella en este momento necesita el apoyo para poder comprar más producto para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad. Aparte de recibir ingresos de su negocio ella y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora para darles una mejora calidad a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Norma Erendira A. sells used tools in a flea market that is well known in the city. She has been in this business of selling this type of merchandise for one year. But, she now needs help to be able to buy more products in order to offer her customers greater variety. Besides the income from her business, she and her husband work in a factory in order to give their four children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Norma Eunice

texts.es: La señora norma Eunice cuenta con negocio desde hace 2 años denominado  “Estanquillo Solís”  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos, nieves para esta temporada de calor y mas. Ahora ella quiere ir comprando más mercancía  por la época de calor en el que mucha gente quiere algo refrescante para no sentir tanto el calor. Es por eso que recurre a esta institución para el apoyo a su negocio y así obtener más ganancia para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia. Pues es madre de 3 hijos a los que prefiere ofrecer una mejora calidad junto co su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora.
texts.en:
For two years, Norma Eunice has had a business called “Estanquillo Solís” where she offers to her clients soft drinks, snacks, ice-cream for this hot season, and more. Her husband works in an assembly factory (maquiladora). She would like to increase her inventory of goods for the hot time of the year since a lot of people want to buy something refreshing to cool themselves. For this reason, Norma Eunice has approached this institution to seek support for her business so that she could increase her profits and be able to meet the household expenses of her family. Norma Eunice is the mother of three children, and, together with her husband, she would like to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store Supplies

loans.name: Presila

texts.es:
Presila es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el sector Lives, una zona rural del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, perteneciente a la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, una región ubicada en la serranía del país, ubicado a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde muy joven, junto a su esposo siembran diversos cultivos y comercializan la leche que producen sus animales. Estos ingresos les han venido sosteniendo desde que se casaron y gracias a estas actividades han sacado adelante a sus hijos los cuales ya se han independizado y formado sus propias familias.

La zona en donde viven se caracteriza por producir diversos granos y cereales. En esta campaña ellos han sembrado maíz y arveja, gracias a estos cultivos esperan captar los ingresos que necesitan para salir adelante durante los siguientes meses. Presila desea realizar labores de deshierbo y fertilización de los cultivos que ha instalado junto a su marido, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Presila es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es bridarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y hacer mejoras en su vivienda que está construida de materiaol rústico.
texts.en:
Presila is 43 years old. A mother of a family, she lives with her husband in the Lives sector, a rural area in the district of Unión Agua Blanca of San Miguel province, in the Cajamarca region. It is located in the mountainous part of the country, four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young, Presila has been working in agriculture and cattle farming. She and her husband grow different crops and sell the milk produced by their animals. The income from these activities has supported them since they got married and allowed them to raise their children who are already independent and have formed families of their own. The area where Presila and her husband live is known for the cultivation of various grains and cereals. This season, they have sown corn and peas; they hope that the crops will result in enough income to allow them to make ends meet over the following months. Presila would like weed out and fertilize the crops that she and her husband have sown. This is why she approached Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to seek a loan of 2000 soles. Presila is a very hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to bring a better quality of life to her family and make improvements to her home, which is currently made from rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cultivation of pea and corn crops

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam

loans.name: Berenilda Edelmira

texts.es:
Berenilda es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector La Portada de la Sierra, en el distrito de San José, provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral en su vivienda, ella cría patos, pavos, gallinas y cuyes para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad para su familia ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como obrero de construcciín civil no son suficientes para solventar la economía familiar.

Berenilda ha ido esforzándose y su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, con las ganancias que ha venido percibiendo ella ha estado implementado una pequeña bodega en su casa con lo que espera percibir nuevas ganancias que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para seguir creciendo y expandiéndose como empresaria por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Berenilda es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que gusta de mucho de trabajar arduamente para ayudarlos a progresar, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior para que se asegure un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Berelinda, age 38, lives with her husband and her son in the sector La Portada de la Sierra, in the district of San José of the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young, Berelinda has been raising and selling barnyard fowl and small farm animals. She grows ducks, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs in order to later sell them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. This business is very useful for Berelinda's family since the income from her husband's job as a construction worker is not sufficient to cover family expenses. Berelinda has worked very hard, and little by little she was able to grow her business. With the profits received from the business, she has been setting up a small grocery shop in her house. She hopes that the shop will bring additional income that would allow her to improve the conditions for her family. Berelinda would like to expand her livestock business in order to keep moving forward and grow as an entrepreneur. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan in the amount of 1500 soles. She plans to invest the funds into the purchase of additional animals and balanced animal feed which would allow her to achieve her goals. Berelinda is a woman who is very devoted to her family; she enjoys working hard to help her family make progress. Her greatest wish is provide her son with an opportunity to go to college so that he could have a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small farm animals and animal feed to expand livestock business

location.town: Portada de la Sierra - San José - Pacasmayo - La L

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion D. is a 70-year-old widow who supports her family by selling dried fish. She lives in Pader, Brgy Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her 7 adult children who are 28 - 43 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dried fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Salvacion is now borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can expand her business. This will be her 20th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through a small sugarcane plantation.

Gloria’s husband helps her in running the business. They have five children who are between 9 and 25 years old. Three of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income through the sugarcane plantation. Now she earns an average monthly income of 26,000 PHP from her business activities.

Gloria is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her sugarcane plantation and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing the amount of 26,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her small sugarcane plantation. Gloria is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for farming

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 31 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos, vive en el sector Huaca Blanca del distrito de Pacanga, en la provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace tres años que llegó a la comunidad en donde vive y desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en labores agrícolas y ganaderas. Actualmente sostiene a su familia con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio de crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores, ella cría los animales hasta que esten lo suficientemente desarrollados para vendérselos a los negociantes que visitan la zona, usualmente cría vacas, borregos y aves de corral.

Carmen ha estado ahorrando dinero durante los últimos meses y ha decidido incursionar en la agricultura: ha arrendado un terreno en el cual ha instalado maíz, ella desea aplicarle fertilizantes y riegos para asegurarse una buena producción, por este motivo se encuentra solictando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Carmen es una madre luchadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder asegurarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Durante el poco tiempo que lleva en la zona se ha sabido ganar el respeto y estima de sus vecinos los que la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. She lives in the Huaca Blanca sector of the District of Pacanga, Chepén Province. This community is in the region of La Libertad and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmen arrived in this community three years ago and has been engaged in farming and raising livestock ever since. She currently supports her family with the income she receives from raising and selling cattle and small animals. Carmen raises her animals until they have developed enough to sell to traders who visit the area. She usually raises cows, sheep, and poultry.

Carmen has been saving money over the past few months so that she could lease some land for growing corn. She wants to apply fertilizers and irrigate the land to ensure a good harvest. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish this goal.

Carmen is a determined mother who is devoted to her family. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman to secure a better quality of life for her children. During the short amount of time she has lived in this area, Carmen has managed to gain the respect and esteem of her neighbors who consider her to be a confident woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to prepare farmland for planting corn

location.town: Huaca Blanca - Pacanga - Chepén - La Libertad

Ana’s husband works as a fisherman to support their big family. They have six children who are between 1 and 22 years old. Some of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through her general store and fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 11,000 PHP from her business activities.

Ana is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operation of her general store and fishing business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 20th loan cycle, she is borrowing the amount of 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store and fishing business. texts.en:
Rhodora A. is from the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rhodora is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rhodora owns & operates a motorcycle transport business of which her husband is the driver operator.  She also has a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members.  Rhodora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Rhodora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhodora has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rhodora is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Rhodora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Virginia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fe Astillero Group

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Mis. Occ.. She is 35 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Fe A. Group'.

Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dry goods in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

On 11-23-2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melina's Group

texts.en:
Melina S. is from the village of Gango, city of Ozamis. She is 51 years old. Melina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Melina is married and has 3 adult and two school-aged children. To make a living, Melina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Melina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Melina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Melina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: J. Repaso's Group

texts.en: Josa R. is from the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Josa is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is J. R.'s Group. Josa is married. To make a living, Josa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Josa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Josa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Josa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon O. is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in ready-to-wear clothing and a pig-fattening businesses. She lives in Barangay Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their three adult children who are 34 to 38 years old. Corazon has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000. Corazon is now borrowing Php 20,000 so that she is able to expand her ready-to-wear clothing and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Corazon aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto Z. O. es obrero y trabaja en una fábrica en la elaboración de puros en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

El solita un crédito en Ceprodel el cual va a utilizar para surtir una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, el quiere ampliar este negocio para así obtener un ingreso mas en su hogar.  

El empezó este negocio hace dos años vendiendo productos de consumo diario y ha ido creciendo por que no hay mas negocio de este tipo cerca, su esposa atiende la pulpería mientras que el Sr. Carlos Z. trabaja en la fábrica de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Este señor antes de ser obrero en esta fabricase dedicaba al comercio ambulante en las comunidades aledaña.

El espera que con este que con la ampliación de su negocio a través del financiamiento el pueda vender mas y lograr satisfacer la demanda y por ende obtener mejore ingresos. Carlos Z. es casado con un hijo que aun no tiene edad escolar.

Este es el crédito numero dos que el ha tenido en Ceprodel en un periodo de seis años, el dice que estos financiamiento le hay ayudado positivamente ya que ha logrado realizar proyectos como el de tener su propio negocio y se muestra agradecido
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Z. O. is a laborer in a cigar factory located in greater Condega. He is asking Ceprodel for funds to stock a grocery store that he has in his home; he wants to expand his business in order to earn more income for his home. He started this business two years ago selling daily consumption items and gradually has grown because there are no other similar businesses nearby; his wife tends to the store while he works at the factory from 7am until 5pm, Monday-Friday. Prior to being a laborer he used to be a peddler in adjacent communities. He hopes that this loan will make it possible for him to enlarge his stock so that he can better meet customer demand thereby earning higher income. Carlos has a son who is still too young to go to school. This is his 2nd loan with Ceprodel in a 6-year period. He states that the financing has been very useful in that he has met goals, like having his own business. He is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items for his store.

loans.name: Hilario De Jesús

texts.es:
El Sr. Hilario de Jesús L. L. es una agricultor del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo que se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado de engorde.

El solita un crédito el que va ocupar para la compra de ganado joven y engordarlo para  luego venderlo y de esta manera obtener una buena ganancia lo que le servirá para el sustento de su gasto familiar

El Sr. Hilario L. empezó este negocio vendiendo ganado de descarte en pequeñas cantidades de vez en cuando hasta que fue creciendo y obteniendo buena clientela. El se a dedicado a esta labor desde hace unos 15 años y el sale al campo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde buscando comprar y vender dicho ganado, cabe señalar que el siempre se ha dedicado a esta labor.

El espera que con el financiamiento  retener más animales y luego engordarlo para que aumente de peso y valor obteniendo así mas ganancia.

Hilario L. es un señor casado, con tres hijos todos en edad escolar a los que el le costea los gastos escolares a través de sus ingresos obtenido de la venta del ganado.
Este es el crédito numero siente que el ha tenido en Ceprodel en un periodo de seis años, el dice que dicho créditos le han ayudado a crecer su negocio ya que ha podido comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Hilario de Jesús L. L. is a farmer in Pueblo Nuevo; he raises cattle. He is asking for funding that he will need to buy young cattle to raise for later resale hoping to earn good profits that will provide support for his family. Mr. L. began his business occasionally selling discarded cattle in small quantities to a few customers; gradually he grew and secured a regular clientele. He has been in this business for 15 years now and he heads to the fields at 7am until the afternoon seeking to buy and sell cattle; it’s worth noting that he has always been in this line of work. He hopes that the financing will make it possible for him to have more heads of cattle to fatten up so that, with increased weight, they will produce higher profits. Hilario is married and has three, school-age children for whom he pays all school expenses using profits from his cattle sales. This current loan is his 7th with Ceprodel in a 6-year period. He states that the loans have helped his business grow in that he has been able to buy more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Maritza del Carmen H. C. es maestra de primaria en un colegio en el área rural del Municipio de Condega.

Maritza va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de  materiales de construcción para construir un dormitorio en la casa de sus padres y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones así como la de su hijos

Ella empezó a trabajar como maestra de primaria una vez que se graduó como maestra hace 4 años y desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta labor. Ella labora de lunes a viernes y viaja media hora en bus hasta su puesto de trabajo, trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Maritza espera poder construir su propio dormitorio en el terreno que sus padres le regalaron y de esta manera tener más privacidad para su familia. Ella es casada y tiene un par de hijos gemelos que aun esta en edad infantil y vive en la casa de sus padres

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel para poder realizar la contracción y die que el impacto a sido positivo y espera ir independizándose  a través de los financiamiento y de esta manera seguir construyendo poco a poco a que sus ingresos son bajos.
texts.en:
Youth Maritza del Carmen H. C. is a primary school teacher at a rural area school in the Condega municipality. Maritza will use the loan to buy construction materials in order to build a bedroom in her parent's home, improving their living conditions as well as her children's. She began working as a primary school teacher as soon as she graduated four years ago, and has been a devoted teacher ever since. She works Monday through Friday and travels half an hour by bus to her place of work, from 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon. Maritza hopes to be able to build her own bedroom on the land her parents gave to her and that way her family can have more privacy. She is married with infant twins and lives at her parent's house. This is her first loan request with Ceprodel, she will use it to carry out construction. She says the impact has been positive and she hopes to become independent through financing, with which she will continue to build little by little as her income is low.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials (zinc, nails, wooden rulers, etc. )

loans.name: Chanara's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanara M. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is 5 years old. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her standard of living. 

Mrs. Chanara M. is 30 years old and she is the leader of this group which consists of five members located in Chan Lork village in Kandal province. The members will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with a 7-year-old son. She lives in Stryi, where she runs a souvenir sales business. She has another sales location in the town of Truskavets, a popular resort in the Carpathian Mountains. Olga sells vases, woodcrafts and other retail souvenir items. She had experience working as a salesperson before she launched her own business. Olga has been in this trade for four years. She enjoys her business very much.

Olga is requesting a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale to tourists vacationing in Western Ukraine. Olga hopes to use additional profits generated by the loan to finish remodeling her home.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of stock

loans.name: Srey Vorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is 25 years old.  She is the leader for a loan to a group of 6 members, who live in Chey Othdom village in Kandal province. The members will use the loans for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is a fish seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Char Y., owns some speakers that he rents to villagers to earn a small income. Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is seeking a loan to buy wood to fix up her house. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy wood to improve a home

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 45 years old. He is married with two children. Vasil sells women's clothing and tights. He has been in this business for seven years. Vasil used to work as an accountant, until he saw this business opportunity and decided to try. Today Vasil attracts his customers with good client service and affordable prices. He's got many repeat clients who buy from him.

Vasil would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase his assortment. His business goal is to start a second location to make more money for his family. This business is his only source of income.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
This loan is being requested by a group of 15 people who all live in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. Mr. Samnang K. is 48 years old and has been selected by the members as village bank president.  The loan recipients will use it for different purposes. 

Mr. Samnang K. and his wife, Mrs. Sroy Nut, are grocery sellers who earn a small income to support their family.  Mr. Samnang K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge his business. With this loan, he hopes to increase income and improve his family's standard of living. This couple has four children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory while the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Bunthun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthun C. is 50 years old. She was selected as village bank president by a group of 15 members.  The members of this group loan live in  Preak Doung village in Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Bunthun C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  She also sells sugar cane.  With these 2 businesses, she earns a small income to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Meng Tuy, is a wedding chef.

Mrs. Bunthun C. is requesting a loan to repair her vehicle and to buy more sugar cane to increase her business activities.
