This couple has eleven children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, three are laborers at a pig farm and five are attending in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle and to purchase more sugar cane

loans.name: Dariya

texts.en:
Dariya is 63 years old and widowed. She sells children's clothing at Trayan market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. She has been in this business for 10 years, and is able to attract many customers through affordable prices and a large variety of clothing.

Dariya is retired but she does not want to stay at home. She wants continue working and help her grandchildren. So she travels 30 miles by bus to get to the market where she has her business. This business is the only source of income for Dariya. 

Dariya would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase 100 children's coats. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase 100 children's coats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for his partner's cosmetics business

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 17-year-old son. She owns a retail business that sells men's clothing. Olesya has been in this business for 2 years. She runs this business together with her husband Mykola. Their monthly income is 6,000 UAH.

Olesya used to work as a salesperson in a similar business at the same market. After she got enough experience, Olesya decided to start her own business. Today she has 2 business locations at the market. Olesya's dream is to move to a small store to do retail business. Olesya would like to borrow 7,500 to purchase 60 pair of jeans.

loans.use: To purchase 60 pairs of jeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a business buying & selling coca leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy children's shoes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 41 años de edad, es separada de su primer esposo actualmente tiene otro esposo quien participa del crédito actual y con el que tiene sus hijos. Cecilia es enfermera y trabaja en diferentes lugares actualmente está en un centro de salud, por otra parte su esposo es quien se dedica al servicios de soldadura ya que el lleva mas de 10 años en el rubro y es bien conocido por la zona del parque industrial de la ciudad. La competencia es bastante alta ya que la zona donde esta el negocio de el esposo es buena y caracterizada por tener este tipo de servicio. Este crédito tuvo tres destinos: 1) cancelación de su saldo anterior. 2) regularización de tramite de inmueble,3) capital de operación para el esposo de la Cecilia. Cecilia en anteriores créditos si tuvo problemas graves de índole familiar por lo que se  atraso en una cuota las demás están puntuales por  lo que se la considera una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Se hace notar que cuando se fue a tomar la foto solo se encontró al esposo de Cecilia, por lo que solo se le tomo la foto a él, Cecilia se encontraba trabajando en un lugar alejado.
texts.en:
Cecelia is 41 years old and has separated from her first husband. She now has another husband who participates in a current loan and with whom she also has children. Cecelia is a nurse who works in different places. She is currently at a health center, while her husband has been providing welding services for over ten years. His business is well-known and located in an industrial area of the city. Competition in his business is quite high but he continues to do well because he is known for providing this type of service. Cecelia’s loan will be used for three purposes: 1. Pay off the balance of her previous loan. 2. Apply to have her property legally registered. 3. Provide operating capital to her husband’s welding business. Cecelia had some serious problems with her previous loans due to family circumstances. Cecilia got behind on one payment, but was punctual with her other payments, and she is generally considered to be a responsible and punctual client. It should be noted that when we went to take her photograph, we only met Cecelia’s husband. We took his picture since Cecelia was working at a remote location. (Cecilia is pictured in the smaller photo in the upper right hand corner.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off previous loan, registration fees, and operating capital for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio es casado con Teresa con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 11, 13 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Cecilio se dedica a prestar sus servicios como maestro albañil y constructor, la conyugue, Teresa, vende desayunos en su carrito de manera ambulante. Ambos cuentan  con muchos años de experiencia en cada uno de sus rubros por lo que también cuentan con el reconocimiento de sus clientes fijos. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad y la experiencia, les ha permitido ser requeridos constantemente por los servicios que prestan. Con el crédito  Cecilio renovara sus herramientas de trabajo para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y por consecuencia para ganar mayor clientela. Este es el cuarto crédito al que accede la Cecilio en nuestra institución. Cecilio siempre demostró excelente cumplimiento de pago en sus créditos anteriores, por otra parte no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Cecilio is married to Teresa with whom he has 4 children, ages 9, 11, 13, and 15 respectively. Cecilio works as a master mason and builder, and his wife, Teresa, sells breakfasts from her little mobile cart. Both can count on many years of experience in their fields, as well as on their recognition by a fixed set of customers. The competition is high, but their years of experience has allowed them to be constantly in demand for the services they offer. With this loan, Cecilio will replace his work tools and be able to offer better service and, as a consequence, gain a larger clientele. This is his 4th loan from our institution. Cecilio has always demonstrated excellent compliance in paying off his previous loans, and moreover, he has no other financial debts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NEW MASONRY WORK TOOLS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es casada, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en la una zona alejada de la ciudad. Emilia administra el alquiler de un camión que es de propiedad de ella y su esposo, tiene terrenos en el Chapare donde ella produce palmito. Recientemente compraron un taxi con el cual está trabajando el esposo. Tienen competencia pero por la experiencia que tienen en el rubro manejan bien su actividades. El destino del crédito es la compra de un equipo de gas para el automóvil que recientemente compraron. Emilia y su esposo tienen un crédito paralelo de 4500 $us en nuestra institución, tienen buen cumplimiento en sus pagos y solo trabajan con nosotros, es decir  no tiene pasivos en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
29 year old Emilia is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in a remote area of the city. Emilia manages the rental of a truck that she and her husband own, and she has land in Chapare where she produces heart of palm. They recently bought a taxi that her husband drives. They are competent and their business experiences enables them to manage their activities well. The loan will be used to buy a gas tank for the car that they recently bought. Emilia and her husband have a parallel loan of $4,500 with our institution, make their payments on time, and only work with us - that is to day, they don't have financial liabilities with any other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a gas tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beef cattle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. M. is a 50-year old hardworking man who operates a bakery. He has been in this business for four years and has five permanent employees. He was previously involved in matatu, a public transport business.  

Since James is the breadwinner in the family, he also farms to increase his earnings. He is a father of four, and three of his children are in school. James belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs where he saves his money. Membership in the group means he is guaranteed if he takes a loan from Faulu Kenya. James has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to buy bigger tables and trays for his business.

loans.use: To buy bigger tables and trays for his bakery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. M. is a 48-year old mother of three who sells cooking gas to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has three employees. Esther also rents residential houses to earn more money to support her family, since she is the breadwinner. She previously ran a retail shop before she ventured into this business. 

In 2001, Esther joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Ushindi. Esther saves her money with the group, which guarantees loans to its members. She has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of cooking gas. Esther hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cooking gas for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret O. is a single woman who sells vegetables, fruits, charcoals and other items from a stall at her home.  She has been in this business for three years and has no other source of income. She sells mainly to neighbors. Her main challenge is that there are few customers in the middle of the month as most of her neighbors get paid at the end of the month. She rents her home, shares electricity with neighbors, and does not have piped water. Her greatest expenses are water and food. 

With the 60,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan Margret is requesting, she wants to buy rice, flour, sugar, kale, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, and charcoal.
She decided to work with Yehu because she liked their policies and loan terms. Her aspiration is to grow economically to be able to support herself. Margret describes herself as hardworking and independent.

loans.use: Rice, flour, sugar, kale, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily K. is a widowed woman with a daughter, 25, and a grandchild, who is turning 4 years old this week and who attends school. Emily has a poultry business and breeds broilers. She has been in this business for one year. The challenge of her business is from the seasonality of her goods as it is busiest in April for Easter, August when many people vacation on the coast, and December during the holidays. 

Previously, Emily taught dressmaking. She now gains additional income from working as a tailor and hairdresser. She owns her home and does not have piped water or electricity. She cites her greatest expenses as food, water, and paraffin.  

With the 25,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan Emily is requesting, she wants to purchase more chicken. Emily is the chairwoman of her loan group and joined Yehu for the support that they provide. She hopes to succeed in life and her wish is that her granddaughter attains higher education.

loans.use: To buy chicken for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab, who is married to a policeman, has two daughters, 20 and 9 years old. With the ksh. 35,000 loan, Zainab wants to purchase a water tank and pay for the labor to set up the taps and pipes. She will then sell water for ksh. 3 per 20 liters. She also owns a retail shop where she sells juice, ice, ground nuts and water. In addition, Zainab rents out two shops and two kiosks to neighbors who sell vegetables and cereals. Zainab cites food, water and electricity as her greatest expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with nine children, three boys and six girls, between the ages of 25 and 4 years old. The oldest child finished primary school but could not go further because of a lack of funds. Ruth's other children are attending school.

With the ksh. 20,000 loan, Ruth wants to purchase coconuts from farmers to sell to the cooperative society that makes palm oil. She has been in this business for ten years and also earns extra income as a farmer, growing cassava and maize to sustain her family.

The main challenge to her business is that the cooperative society is inconsistent and sometimes pays her late. She rents her home and does not have either water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Ruth joined Yehu because she likes its structure and the fact that she could join without having to save a minimum amount.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: For about five years Rugiatu K., a married mother of three children, has owned a pharmacy along one of the busy streets in the city of Makeni.  Rugiatu was a client in the solidarity group structure with a good credit history. Over the years her business has been doing well despite having a low amount of capital.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase more drugs that are needed in the community and hopes to use the increased proceeds to educate her children and construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S., a trader in used clothing, is single and has two dependents (younger brothers) living with him.  He inherited the sales of used clothing from his father, and knowing full well that the trade is profitable, he thought it fit to maintain the same product.  With 15 years of experience in trade, Ibrahim is now seeking a loan to acquire more stock and generate more income which he will eventually use to improve his and his brothers'  education. He is also determined to construct a dwelling house for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en: Lonah is married to a businessman. They have three girls and one boy between the ages of 11 and 3. Her children attend school. Lonah owns a stall where she serves food and plans to use her loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, and milk. She has been in this business for three years and her customers are mainly students and masons, who work nearby. Her main challenge is that the food she has prepared spoils when she does not have enough customers. She joined Yehu because the interest rates are low and she's in their target group. She rents her home which has electricity but no piped water. Lonah's biggest monthly expenses are rent and electricity. She hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil and milk

loans.name: Ndzame

texts.en: Nzame is a widow with four daughters and five sons. She sells coconuts and cassavas. With the ksh.30,000 loan, she wants to pay farmers for premature coconuts, which she will pick up once they are ripe three months later. She has been in this business for 8 years and has no other sources of income. She sells the coconuts at the market, door to door and from home. The most difficult part of her business is transporting her goods door to door, especially when there is little demand. She owns her home but does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and paying for hospital bills. Ndzame hopes to lead a happy life and to raise her living standard.

loans.use: Coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs, a DVD player, and screen

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba C. is married with three children all of whom attend school. She trades in assorted shoes and slippers, something she has done for over ten years, and knows that this trade is lucrative so wants to invest more money in the business. Kumba is seeking a loan that will enable her to buy more stock. She hopes to use proceeds from the loan to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes and slippers

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. She rents a vending stall in one of the market stores to sell groceries. However, the store could be closed any day leaving Irina out in the street. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to buy a vending kiosk in the local market. She has been in the business for 11 years and has about 100,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. Irina is hoping to expand her trade and later re-construct this vending kiosk into a small grocery store. She has promptly repaid 9 previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase a vending kiosk in the local marketplace

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown sons. She owns a grocery store selling baked goods, canned food, drinks, and snacks. Her store is located next to a busy local marketplace. Ludmila launched this enterprise 11 years ago and presently has over 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Ludmila is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to stock her store. She wants to expand into different types of groceries, vegetables and fruit that sell well. Ludmila has a good reputation among her neighbors and fellow vendors. She is characterized as a tactful and respectful person.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married with a son. She is a small entrepreneur from the town of Vasilyevka. Tamara sells clothing merchandise and household retail items in one of the local marketplaces in her town. She has been in this business for three years. Her gross income amounts to 8,600 Grivnyas a month.  

Tamara is requesting a loan of 10,300 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise and keep her income stable as a result. We believe consistent demand, outstanding credit history and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Harold Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Mejía A. trabaja como asalariado en INATEC.
El va a utilizar el crédito para cubrir gastos personales ya que tiene enferma a su esposa y necesita comprar medicamentos, además quiere comprar ciertos electrodomésticos que son útiles para su hogar. 

El Sr. Mejía ha tenido 6 créditos con la Institución los cuales han sido cancelados, y a la vez nos dijo que está muy satisfecho con todas las atenciones que se le han hecho por parte de la Institución CEPRODEL, ya que cuando el ha tenido problemas lo han sabido comprender.
texts.en:
Mr. Mejía A. is a salaried worker at INATEC. He will use the loan to cover personal costs as his wife is sick and he needs to buy medicine. Also he wants to buy certain household appliances that will be useful in his home. Mr. Mejía has had 6 loans with this institution all of which have been canceled, he told us that he is very satisfied with the attention the institution CEPRODEL has given to him, and when he has had problems they have been able to understand.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses and to buy household appliances

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Fanny es una mujer que se dedica a su propio negocio, con 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos estudiante. El negocio es un Cyber que logro poner hace cinco años, es un negocio que le deja ganancia, es por eso desea invertir mas para dar cada día un mejor servicio, mejor tecnología por la demanda. Con este préstamo desea comprar| una computadora más con todos sus accesorios para poner otro cubículo en el cyber, con el objetivo de dar más cobertura a sus clientes, y poder obtener más ingresos. Sus planes a futuro es comprar una vitrina para vender cosmético y aprovechar la clientela que llega al cyber.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman who dedicates herself to her business. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who are still studying. Her business is a cyber cafe that she was able to open some 5 years ago. It is a profitable business, and for that reason she wants to increase investment in order to provide better technology and offer better services each day. With this loan she wishes to buy an added computer with all its accessories, and to install another cubicle, providing better coverage for her customers and obtaining more income. Her future plan is to buy a showcase to help sell cosmetics, taking advantage of the clientele who come to her cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A COMPUTER WITH ALL ACCESSORIES TO OFFER CUSTOMERS BETTER COVERAGE

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La señora Meris es dueña de una pulpería que está ubicada en la zona urbana de la ciudad de El Viejo, tiene quince años de tener ese negocio.

Ella va utilizar el crédito para la compra para  la compra de cuatro viajes de leña ya que se aproxima el invierno y se incrementa el precio de la misma, y suele haber escases en dicho periodo.

Doña Meris es una señora de 63 Años, acompañada no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido el cual el también le ayuda en lo que es la pulpería ya que es su único medio de alimentación diaria.

Este es el crédito No. 25 que tiene con CEPRODEL los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma por lo cual dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por haber ayudado a crecer en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meris owns a grocery store located in the urban zone of the city El Viejo, she has had the business for fifteen years. She will use the loan to buy four trips of firewood, as winter approaches the price of it increases and it becomes more scarce. Mrs. Meris is a 63 year old woman, accompanied with no children, she only lives with her husband who helps her with the grocery store as it is the only source of their daily diet. This is loan No. 25 with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid well on time, she says she is very grateful for the institution as they have helped her to grow her business and family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and basic grains for her grocery store.

loans.name: Arelis Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora

loans.use: To buy food items like: rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, chicken, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Esther Kahaso

texts.en:
Esther Kahaso M. is a 38-year-old married woman with four children between eleven and two years of age. Esther moves from one place to another selling kanga (traditional African cloth).  She has been in the business for a period of about three years earning a monthly profit of approximately 6,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock of kanga in order to increase her profit margin to sustain her family. She hope to expand her current business.

loans.use: Buy more Kangas

loans.name: Hilda Clarisa

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 51 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos ya independizados, vive en el cercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte.

La necesidad de salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos hizo que hace ocho años empezara un negocio de venta de comida en su domicilio, empezó con pocos utensilios e insumos y gracias a su esfuerzo el negocio ha ido creciendo, actualmente ya tiene un pequeño restaurante en donde atiende a sus clientes todos los dias, en su mayoría son trabajadores de la zona que acuden a almorzar durante la hora de almuerzo, su buena sazón y la amabilidad con la que trata a sus clientes han hecho que su negocio goce de muy buena preferencia.

La continua demanda por su negocio ha hecho que los insumos con los que cuenta no sean suficientes para brindar una buena atención, por ello Hilda desea ampliar su restaurante con la compra de mesas, sillas y algunos insumos para preparar más platos de comida, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen, las cuales la consideran una mujer de confianza y luchadora.
texts.en:
Hilda is 51 years old, divorced, and has 3 children who are independent. She lives near the city of Chiclayo, a city well known for its commercial and transport activity. The need to move ahead and help her children some 8 years ago led her to launch a business selling meals from her house. She began with few utensils and little supplies and thanks to her effort, the business has grown. At present, she already has a small restaurant where she waits on customers every day. The majority are workers from the zone who come for lunch around lunch time. The good flavors of her food and the amiability she displays towards her customers has resulted in the restaurant gaining favor. The rise in demand has resulted in short supplies, affecting her service. For that reason, Hilda wishes to buy more supplies and to expand her restaurant by buying tables and chairs. Then she will be able to prepare more plates of food. For that reason, she approached Edpyme Alternative for the first time, requesting a loan of 2,000 new sols that will help her achieve her objective. Hilda is an amiable woman who likes her work very much. Her great hope is to continue growing as an impresario. She is much admired by those who know her. They consider her a woman with confidence and fighting spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TABLES, CHAIRS, AND SUPPLIES TO IMPROVE SERVICES IN HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Magali Francisca

texts.es: La señora M. S., tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual atiende personalmente con la ayuda de su hijo mayor,  con los prestamos que se le han atendido ha venido ampliando su negocio y mejorando su vivienda con las ganancia que le genera la pulpería, con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como mecánico, mantienen los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos. Ahora necesita de este nuevo financiamiento para mejorar el inventario de la mercadería de y dar mayor atención a sus clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. has a grocery store in her home which she tends to herself with help from her oldest son. The loans she has had have made it possible for her to expand her business and profits from the store have made home improvements possible. With her husband’s help, who works as a mechanic, they are able to support their household and provide education for their children. She needs new funding to buy stock items for her store so that she can provide better customer service and thus earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store like: sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, corn, coffee,soap, paper, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
La Sra. Meléndez R. vive en el municipio de Morazán-Tonalá. 
Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la Reparación y mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno y quiere reparar el techo de su casa y hacer mejorías a la misma.

Ella ha tenido 5 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma, además dice estar agradecido por todos los apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meléndez R. lives in Morazán-Tonalá. She will use the funds to make home repairs because winter is approaching and she wants to repair the roof and make some other home repairs. She has had 5 loans with the institution which have all been repaid in a timely fashion. She states that she is grateful for all the help she’s gotten.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Urania es una señora de 49 años, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposo e hijos, su negocio es una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos desde hace un año, pues anteriormente tenía un taxi, el cual vendió ya que no estaba dando los resultados, mas bien tenían que invertir en el. Con este préstamo desea invertir mas en la pulpería en productos de leche en pote para bebe, granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, pollo, carnes y otras variedades de alimentación para ofrecer a sus clientes y competir con la demanda. Con su crédito anterior logro hacer un cuarto en su casa el cual se ha beneficiado a través de estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Urania is 49 years old and lives with her husband in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliacion. Urania has been running a small store for about a year, where she sells a variety of products. Prior to that, she drove a taxi, but she sold the taxi because it wasn't generating good results. It was better for her to invest in her store. This loan will be used to purchase milk, basic grains, sweets, sodas, chicken, meat and other grocery staples for her customers. She has benefited already from these loans, as her previous credit helped her to set up her store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her small store, such as basic grains, milk, sodas, chicken, meat, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector Barrio Nuevo Santa Rosa, una zona rural y de bajos recursos del distrito Cura Mori, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos estable con la cual sacar adelante a los suyos hizo que hace un año incursionara en el negocio de crianza y venta de animales, el cría animales menores y aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte podterior de su vivienda, cuando estos ya se han desarrollado completamente los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive.

La demanda que se presenta en la zona han hecho que el piense en ampliar su negocio, por ello desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para acelerar su desarrollo, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. De esta manera el podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.

Jorge es un padre bastante responsable y que siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 24-year-old father who lives with his wife and their two young children in Barrio Nuevo Santa Rosa, a low-resource rural zone of the Cura Mori district, which is in the Piura province of Piura region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. The need to obtain a stable source of income with which he can help his children get ahead in life led him to begin a business a year ago raising and selling animals. He raises small animals and poultry behind his house. When the animals have developed completely, he sells them to businessmen who visit the area in which he lives. The demand present in the area has led him to think of expanding his business. For this reason he wants to buy more animals to expand his business and balanced feed to speed their development. He has therefore found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan of 500 new soles. In this way, he will be able to increase his sales and earn a higher income. Jorge is a very responsible father who always tries to help his family get ahead. His greatest desire is to give them a better quality of life. He is well-known and liked in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small animals, poultry and balanced feed for expansion of business

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
El Sr. U. García vive en el municipio de Tonalá-Morazán.
El va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de materiales para la reparación de su vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno y necesita reparar el techo de su casa así como la reparación de la misma.

El ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y a la vez dice estar muy agradecido con la institución por toda la ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. U. García lives in Tonalá-Morazán. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies because winter is approaching and he needs to repair his roof and do some other home repairs. He has had 4 loans with the institution which have all been repaid in a timely fashion. He states that he is very grateful to the institution for all the help it has given him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nilda Mercedes

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 19 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Piura, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de ropa y sandalias en su propio domicilio, también reparte su mercadería en base a pedidos que realizan sus vecinos y personas de diferentes zonas aledañas. El negocio le permite agenciarse de una fuente importante de ingresos económicos con los cuales ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.

Nilda tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir, gracias a la promoción que le hacen sus propios clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir y sandalias para seguirlas ofreciendo a sus clientes.

Ella es una joven trabajadora y que siempre trata de salir adelante a través del trabajo en su negocio. Su más grande anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria, ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus clientes y conocidos que la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Nilda is 19 years old and lives with her husband in the "9 de Octubre" neighborhood, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Piura, the capital of the region of the same name, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For 2 years she has been selling clothing and sandals from her home. In addition, she distributes her merchandise based on orders that she takes from her neighbors and from people who live in surrounding areas. The business allows her to procure an important source of income to help support her family. Nilda has many orders to fill, thanks to a sales promotion that she carried out with her customers. For this reason she is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of more garments and sandals to offer her customers. She is a hardworking youth who always tries to get ahead through her work in her business. Her greatest wish is to be able to grow as a businesswoman. She is very well known and appreciated by her customers and acquaintances, who consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy garments and sandals to expand her business

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Don Ramón tiene la edad de 45 años, junto con su esposa, procrearon cuatro hijos, ella trabaja como costurera y apoya a la familia. El señor Ramón trabaja en seguridad desde hace varios años, y poco h apoco ha ido mejorando su casa que era de concreto y tabla, las mejora que ha hecho es quitar la madera y la hecho toda de concreto, aun le falta tiene material que utilizar en las mejoras pero no ajusto para la mano de obra es por eso con este crédito lograra terminar las mejora a la casa, como comenzar hacer el muro para reguardar mas su propiedad, y a su familia. Comprara mas piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar el muro que es de mucha necesidad.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 45, and his wife have four children. His wife works as a seamstress and helps the family. Ramón has been working in security for several years. Little by little he has been improving his house. It was made of concrete and boards. The improvement he has made is taking out the wood and making it all concrete. It still needs work. He has some material to make the improvements, but he does not have the money to pay for the labor. With this loan he will finish the home improvements. He will start to build a wall to better protect his property and his family. He will buy more rock, sand, cement, and iron to start the much needed wall.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rock, sand, cement, and iron to start building a wall around his house for better security

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. D. Rodríguez vive en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

 El Sr. D. va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su negocio en la compra de controladores, discos, CD, etc.

Se dedica al alquiler de nintendo, el  tiene 5 años de tener el negocio es propio y ya lleva 10 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos han sido cancelados.

El es soltero no tiene hijos ni esposa ya que es muy dedicado en su negocio y ahí pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo.
El se siente muy satisfecho con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le han brindado y la ayuda que ha recibido cuando mas lo ha necesitado.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Rodríguez lives in El Viejo, Chinandega department. He will use the funds to stock his business buying game controlers, discs, CDs, etc. He rents Nintendo games; he’s had this business for 5 years and has had 10 previous loans with the institution, all of which have been repaid in a timely fashion. He is single; he has neither wife nor children so he is very dedicated to his business and spends most of his time there. He is very satisfied with the institution for all the help it has given him; he has received help when he has most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Nintendo game accessories

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. T. Martínez  vive en Tomballe una comunidad que está ubicada en la zona rural del municipio del viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El va a utilizar el crédito para compra de 2 novillos de desarrollo ya que es un ganadero-agricultor con 30 años de Experiencia.

Actualmente el Sr. T. Martínez cuenta con 67 cabezas de ganados entre ellos vacas paridas, terneros, bueyes, toro, etc.

El dice sentirse muy agradecido con la Institución porque gracias al apoyo que le han dado ha podido surtir su rubro ganadero y así llevar el alimento  diario a su casa ya que realiza ventas de ganado cuando necesita efectivo para sembrar.
texts.en:
Mr. T. Martínez lives in Tomballe, a community located in a rural area outside of the town of Viejo in the department of Chinandega. He will use the loan to buy two young bulls to raise, as he is a farmer and rancher with more than 30 years of experience. Currently Mr. T. Martínez has 67 head of cattle, including dairy cows, calves, oxen, and bulls. He says he is grateful to the Kiva field partner because thanks to their support he has been able to vary the types of animals he has. This has allowed him to keep food on the table each day, because he is able to sell cattle when he needs money for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Laura Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Laura Cristina tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de manzanas decorados. 
 Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de producto, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder comprar el material y tener mas variedad y su negocio tendrá más ingreso.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Fausto Francisco Gutiérrez, quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
For more than a year, Laura Cristina has been making and selling candy apples. Her business needs a greater variety of products, but she does not have the necessary money. For this reason she requests a loan to buy raw materials so that she can have a greater variety of products, and so that her business will generate more income. She plans to pay off the loan with the profits from her business since her husband, Fausto Francisco Gutiérrez, is in charge of covering the household expenses. He works as a security guard for a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material to make candy apples

loans.name: Johany Jackely

texts.es:
Johany tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de La Unión, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de aves de corral: ella cría patos, gallinas y pavos en la parte posterior de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus vecinos. Este negocio le brinda ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Johany siempre da lo mejor de si para mejorar la calidad de sus animales de modo que estos tengan buena acogida y pueda percibir mayores ganancias, por ello piensa ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral así como de alimento balanceado de modo que su desarrollo se acelere y pueda lograr su objetivo rápidamente. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera ves a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Johany es una joven responsable y con grandes planes para el futuro, ella sueña con seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder instalar una granja. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una joven trabajadora y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Johany is 21, single, and lives with her parents. They live in the La Unión district, which belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For one year she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises ducks, hens, and turkeys in the back of her house. She sells them to the business people who visit her area and to her neighbors. This business provides income to pay her personal expenses and to help with the household economy. Johany always gives the best of herself to improve the quality of her animals. She does this so that they will be well received and she will be able to get greater earnings. She plans on expanding her business by purchasing more poultry. She will also buy balanced feed to speed up their growth and achieve her objective quickly. That is why she is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Johany is a responsible young woman who has big plans for the future. She dreams of continuing to grow as a businesswoman and being able to set up a farm. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem. They consider her to be a hard-working young woman who always helps when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry and balanced feed to expand her business

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 40 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector El Indio, una zona urbano Marginal de distrito de Castilla, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que funciona desde hace mas de un año, el negocio nació de la necesidad de obtener un ingreso estable con el cual ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante y ayudar en los gastos de la casa. Como el negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso Nancy trata de mantenerlo ofreciendo un buen servicio y productos de primera necesidad.

Sus continuos esfuerzos por sacar su bodega adelante han  dando resultado y su establecimiento poco a poco esta creciendo, así como su demanda, ella desea adquirir mas productos para ofrecerlos en venta a sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Nancy es una mujer luchadora: siempre trata de encontrar la manera de sacar adelante a sus menores hijos que son su motivación diaria, su mayor anhelo es verlos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien. Sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Nancy, 40, is separated and has two children, ages 14 and 12. They all live in her parents' house in El Indio sector, an outlying urban zone of Castilla District, Piura province, Piura region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region's capital. For a year she has worked selling staples and groceries in a store. This business was born from her need to obtain a steady income, with which she can help her children get ahead and help to cover household expenses. Since the business is her only source of income, Nancy tries to maintain it, offering good service and essential products. Her continual efforts to improve her store have had good results, and her business is growing little by little. She wants to get more products to offer for sale to her customers. For this reason she has had to ask Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan of 500 new soles, which will help her achieve her goal. Nancy is a determined woman: she is always trying to find a way to help her children, who are her daily motivation, to get ahead in life. Her greatest desire is to see them become professionals and well-off men. Her customers and neighbors consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staples and groceries for business expansion

loans.name: Analllely

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Anallely L. le está haciendo falta las bardas al frente de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que necesita.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la mejora que le hace falta a su casa, ya que su esposo trabaja todo el día y solo sequedad ella y su pequeño hijo.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Brayan Jesus Gómez, como empleado de una agencia aduanal en el aria de tramitador.
texts.en:
Señora Anallely L. needs a fence around the front of her house, but she lacks the money necessary to be able to buy the required materials. For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can make this needed improvement to her house, since her husband works all day and she is there alone with her small son. She plans to pay for the loan with income that her husband, Señor Brayan Jesus Gómez, earns working as an expediter for a customs brokerage.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make a fence around the front of her house

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Las Mercedes, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Castilla, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta ambulante de comida en una avenida bastante transitada y frecuentada por transportistas, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a su buena sazón y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes, como la demanda está creciendo ella es ayudada por una prima, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Nelly desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más utensilios con los cuales pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo de modo que pueda percibir mas ganancias y seguir creciendo como empresaria.

Ella es una joven responsable y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, su mayor anhelo es poder tener su propio restaurante. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer dinámica y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Nelly is 27 years old and single. She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Las Mercedes sector. This is an urban zone on the border of the Castilla district, which belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been selling food as a street vendor. She sells on a pretty busy street, which is frequented by lots of drivers. The business enjoys being well received due to its good seasoning and the good customer service. As demand is growing, a cousin helps her. The income she gets from this activity is used for her personal expenses and to help support her family. Nelly wants to expand her business by purchasing more utensils, which will allow her to offer better service. To do this she has seen the need to ask, for the first time, for a loan for 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan will help her achieve her objective so that she can get more income and keep growing as a businesswoman. She is a responsible young woman, and she really likes the work she does. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own restaurant. The people who know her consider her to be a dynamic woman who is always ready to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils to improve service and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a wall around his house

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa G. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos con los cuales a realizado mejorar a su negocio. 
Solicita nuevamente apoyo en este préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta algunos acabados del interior del local y comprar mercancía. 
Pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario poder llevar acabos la mejora e invertir en el negocio es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito.
Planea pagar con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa G. is very grateful for the cooperation she received through her previous loans, which were used to make improvements to her business.

She is requesting a new loan to help with making some interior finishes that are lacking in her shop and to buy merchandise. Maria does not have the money necessary to carry out these improvements and invest in her business, so she is requesting your cooperation with this loan.

She plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish remodeling her shop and acquire merchandise for her business

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
El Sr. T. Meléndez vive en el municipio del viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El va a utilizar el crédito en la Reparación y mantenimiento de la maquinaria que utiliza para la siembra.

El Sr. T. Meléndez ha tenido 11 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien.

El dice estar muy agradecido por todas las atenciones que le han brindado en CEPRODEL, así como todo el apoyo que le han brindado en los créditos obtenidos.
texts.en:
Mr. T. Meléndez lives in the town of Viejo in the department of Chinandega. He will use the loan in the repair and maintenance of the machinery that he uses for planting. Mr. T. Meléndez has taken out 11 loans with the field partner and has repaid them all on time. He says that he is very grateful for the help he has received at CEPRODEL [the Kiva field partner], as well as the support they have provided for his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of farm machinery

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
El señor José Daniel T. esta terminando la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de la vivienda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que en horario a adicional a su empleo el se encargara de la construcción. Desea que sus hijos tengan ya su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa. 
Don José Daniel trabaja en la vecina ciudad en un restaurante de comida Mexicana, como cocinero, con una parte de este sueldo planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Ana Cecilia González esposa del señor José Daniel T., ya el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita a la vivienda.
texts.en:
José Daniel T. is finishing the construction of a room on the top floor of his house. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the material. He will do the construction in the hours he is not working for his employer. He wants his children to have their own space and privacy in the house. Don José Daniel works in the neighboring city in a Mexican food restaurant. He is a cook, and he will use part of this salary to pay the loan. The person in the photo is Ana Cecilia González, his wife. José Daniel T. was at work the day of the visit to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room on the top floor

loans.name: Laura Lizbeth

texts.es: La señorita Laura Lizbeth D.
texts.en: Laura Lizbeth D.

loans.use: Change the roof

loans.name: Martha Pastora

texts.es:
La Sra. Ríos vive en el municipio del viejo departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de mercadería para surtir su  pulpería
Esta señora vive solo con su marido ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven en casa aparte. 
Este es el primer crédito que se le ha otorgado a la Sra. Ríos, lo cual ella dice que espera en Dios pagarlo bien en tiempo y forma para poder seguir trabajando con la Institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ríos lives in the town of Viejo in the department of Chinandega. She will use the loan money to buy merchandise to better stock her small grocery store. She lives alone with her husband because her children are grown and living on their own. This is Mrs. Ríos' first loan, and she says that with God's help she hopes to repay it on time so that she can continue to work with the Field Partner.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Julia Ester

texts.es:
La Sra. R. Gaitán vive en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.  
Ella va utilizar el crédito  para la construcción de una cocina que necesita hacer en su casa de habitación.

Este es el crédito no. 9 que tiene en la Institución  los cuales ha cancelado sin ningún problema.
Ella dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por atenderla durante tantos años y comprenderla cuando ha tenido problemas, ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos el cual es taxista y le ayuda en todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. R. Gaitán lives in the town of Viejo, in the department of Chinandega. She will use the loan to build a kitchen that she needs in the house where she lives. This is her 9th loan with the Kiva field partner, and she has repaid all the previous loans with no problems. She is thankful to the field partner for having worked with her for so many years and for understanding her when she has needed help. She lives with her husband, who is a taxi driver. and her three children. Her husband helps with all the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction (addition of a kitchen)

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en: Bashiran sells embroidered shawls (a garment for head and shoulders) to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She has been in this business for seven years and is making much progress in her business. She is 38 years old and married. Her husband operates a cloth shop in the cloth market and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan to purchase embroidered shawls to sell.

loans.use: To purchase embroidered shawls to sell

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed A. R. is an energetic woman who makes and sells parandas (ornaments used by women to tie-up their hair) at her home. She has five years of experience in this business and now she has become expert in it she can make different kinds of parandas such as simple and heavy-beaded.

Khursheed has no other source of income. She sells mainly to neighbors. She owns a two-room house and has been living in it for over twenty-five years.

With the Pak Rs. 35,000 loan Khursheed is requesting, she wants to buy thread and beads in bulk. She decided to work with Asasah because she liked its policies and loan terms. Her aspiration is to make her business famous. She describes herself as hardworking and independent.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more parandas

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz is the wife of M. M. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room house and has been living in it for over thirty years.

Kaniz describes herself as hardworking. Her business is making artificial flower sets and she has been doing this for over ten years. She makes flowers to order and earns a good income which allows her to manage her financial expenses.

Kaniz’s husband runs a games shop in the community. His shop is always filled with young kids. He also supports their home. Kaniz is applying for a loan to purchase a billiard table to expand her husband’s games business.

loans.use: To buy a billiard table for her husband's game shop

loans.name: Rakha Pansheir Group

texts.en:
Pary Gull is the group leader of Rakha Pansheir Group. She lives in 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan with her husband and two of her children who are students.

Pary Gull’s husband has a metal shop. He is a hardworking man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children. Through the loan, her husband wants to expand his business and to buy some essential tools which can make his work easier.

These group members are very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan that helps the poor people of this country.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business and buy some essential tools

loans.name: Julynda

texts.en:
Julynda B. is from the village of Mansabay Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Julynda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Julynda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh fish in the local community. Julynda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8420 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julynda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Julynda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Julynda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ghieliza's Group

texts.en:
Ghieliza J. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Ghieliza is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ghieliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ghieliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh fish in the local community. Ghieliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ghieliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ghieliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Ghieliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for fish vending. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ghieliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Ronda Karen

texts.en:
Ronda Karen M. is from the village of Tawi-tawi Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Ronda Karen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronda Karen owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to the local community. Ronda Karen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronda Karen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronda Karen is requesting a loan of 33,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronda Karen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida V., from the village of Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 59 years old, married and has six adult and school-aged children. To make a living, she has owned a piggery for the past six years, earning approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC to buy feed and other materials for her business, Aida is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 8,000 PHP, again for her piggery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and other needs for pigs.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. With a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Grace is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns a fishing business where she sells primarily squid in the local community. Grace has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.  Grace has just joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first GDMPC loan, for 5,000 PHP, to purchase additional fish to sell.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: The five members in this group loan all live in Prachum Ang village in Kandal province. They will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. SokN. P. was selected to be the group leader by all the members. She is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare plot of land on which she grows vegetables for selling to support her family. She now is challenged by infertile soil in her field, and in order to improve productivity of her vegetable crop, Mrs. SokN. P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people from Sleng Kong village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan. Mrs. Phally C. was selected as village bank president by all the group members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her children and husband, Mr. Sok C. Lai. He is a construction worker earning a small salary for supporting his family. Now they are having difficult living circumstances because their house does not have a lavatory to use. So, Mrs. Phally C. has decided to request a loan to construct a lavatory to use. She is mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To construct a lavatory to use.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida B. is a hard working entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2005 to gain access to loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.  The first few loans she received enabled her to support the family’s fish selling business and hog fattening business. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family income.  She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount of 45,000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs and to support the maintenance of their fishing business.  The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support Adelaida’s dream that her children will complete college degrees and find good jobs.

Adelaida hopes to maintain long-term sustainable businesses.  During the course of her membership in ASHI, she has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s operations.  Her future goals are to purchase a new jeepney for her husband so they can expand the territory of their fish selling business to other surrounding neighborhoods. By owning her own transportation, Adelaida will save time and money in selling products in additional territories. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Adelaida is hopeful that her businesses will continue to be more productive and improve her overall standard of living for her whole family.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for the pigs, and to support the maintenance of their fishing business.

loans.name: Mrs. Saret Chay Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people from Preaek Bak village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve living conditions for their families. Mrs. Saret C. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. U. Luk, own a general store in the local village to earn money to support their family. Since their business is going well they want to expand it, but they did not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Saret C. has decided to seek a loan to buy more groceries for reselling. This couple has three children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for reselling.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en: Jeaneth S. is from the lush green town of Jala-jala, Rizal. She is 39 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Jeaneth sells placenta soap and coco jam products in the village and nearby towns.  Jeaneth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week. Jeaneth joined ASHI in 1996 to secure access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASHI, and is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of her placenta soap and inventories of coco jam products. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jeaneth from ASHI.  She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition of moving away under the umbrella of poverty, expanding her business, and paying for the needs of her two children in school. For supplementary revenue, she also dreams of purchasing new tricycle for her husband, Gabriel, a carpenter who also closely works with her.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has nine people who are villagers in Kaoh Kaev Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vanna S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use the loan for different purposes. 

She is a tailor in a local village who earns some money for supporting her family's living. In order to improve her family's living conditions, she wants to expand her business, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Vanna S. decided to apply for a loan to buy more cloth to tailor. 

Her husband is a teacher in a local school. She is a mother of three children who are all attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to tailor

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
54-year-old Encarnacion S. wants the remaining three of her seven children to graduate from college and have a better career in the future. Being a mother who works hard in trying to sustain the education of all her children despite her poverty, she feels sad that her four elder children have to quit from schooling because of her incapability to support their financial needs. However, when ASHI came into her life offering her the opportunity to receive a loan for financing a business, she became hopeful again. 

From the time her first loan was received, until the present loan she is requesting, Encarnacion has been trying to grow and finance a seafood buy-and-sell business in partnership with her unemployed husband. With the profit of this business, although savings are yet hard to achieve, she was able to support and sustain the education of her children. She has been also able to support the needs of her four elder children, if they can’t get hired as laborers.

Encarnacion and her husband sell their products in the public market and also to people around their village. With the loans, she can always have an access to these sales. She is determined to reach her ambition of improving the life of her family by growing her business and its profit.

loans.use: To purchase fish and other sea foods for selling.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has fO. people who live in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chan K. is the group leader who has been selected by all the group members. Mrs. Chan K. and her husband are farmers who own 0.70-hectare of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family's living. They have two children, one of whom is attending a local school, while the other is a white wine-maker and besides this, he is a pig breeder also. In order to improve their child’s business, Mrs. Chan K. applied for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. Him H. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Tha TH., have been married since 2004. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Him has been driving a horse cart for more than seven years. His wife is a silk weaver. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase an additional horse for his business. And he will use a part of his loan to purchase silk materials for his wife to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy an additional horse for his business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
In 2005, Magdalena joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost five years, she has noted very good performance in her attendance at center meeting, and her weekly repayment and business still exists. As a result, she is qualified to obtain larger loans. 

She runs a food stall business. She started her business through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to maintain her business; it gives them a good income to support her children's education. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income.

She hopes to increase her food vending business and expand it to other villages. Her five children are her motivation to track her food stall business. She now feels very happy with the service of ASHI and KIVA. It gives her a big possibility to pursue her family's dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and assist many families who want to get ahead.

Her long-term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business, to build a concrete and durable home, and to support the education of her children. Magdalena is hopeful that her food vending business ventures will continue to grow and improve her overall standard of living so it's far away from the spiral of poverty.

Magdalena is a 37-year old woman, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband worked jointly to raise their big family. Magdalena is also a mother of good faith to defeat all challenges to reach her dreams.

loans.use: As additional working capital to improve her business and her income.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: Four people who are villagers in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Mrs. Vorn C. is the group leader, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell to support her family. She now faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve production of vegetables, Mrs. Vorn C. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory and the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phai Y. is a group leader for a loan to four people who live in Tuol Krasang village in Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Phai Y. earns money for her family by breeding pigs.  Her husband, Mr. Van Vet, is a construction worker.  She has three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is a laborer.   Mrs. Phai Y.'s business is going well and she wants to expand it.  She is seeking a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeung C. and her husband, Mr. Lim Long, live on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home.  One weaves silk at home and another two attend school.

Voeung is a silk weaver. Her husband is a house builder, and he also runs a battery-charging business. Voeung has received a Kiva loan in the past.  She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk materials for the weaving business that she runs with her daughter..

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina E. makes bamboo furniture for a living. She has been engaged in her business for more than 28 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a week. In 1997, she joined ASHI to secure access to financial support to help improve her living condition and her ability to engage in more entrepreneurial business activities. She and her husband, Jaime, have successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.
