El Banco Comunal Riqueza inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. Condimentos, medicinas, pescado, mercería, animales menores, comida, también brindan servicios D. carpintería, sastrería, bordados.
Como es el caso D. L. Señora Marleny es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, Marleny es separada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Marleny tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. 2 personas. Además Marleny es cantante folklórica y se dedica a L. animación D. diversos eventos y compromisos. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz y aceite. Los sueños D. Marleny son tener una casa propia, sacar adelante a sus hijos y realizar una grabación.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles haciendo un total D. 10,650 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Riqueza" is beginning its second cycle with 15 members. The members all have different businesses like: selling condiments, medicines, fish, sewing materials, small animals, and food. They also proviD. services like carpentry, shoe making, sewing, and embroidery. Señora Marleny is the communal bank's president. Marleny is separated, 32 years old,and has two children. Marleny has a restaurant in a rented space where she works everyday. She has two people who help her. Marleny is also a folkloric singer who puts on different sorts of events and engagements. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, and oil. Marleny's dreams are to have her own home, to help her kids get ahead, and to make a recording. Each member is applying for a differernt amount of money: 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles which makes a total of 10,650 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Paulina De

texts.es: Paulina tiene 58 años de edad y recién ha quedado viuda ya que su esposo falleció de un paro cardiorrespiratorio. No tiene hijos pequeños que dependan de ella pero el único hijo que tiene aún vive con ella en su domicilio que es propio. Paulina  tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio con muchos años de antigüedad y ofreciendo sus productos a su vecindad. Paulina no tiene una competencia cercana por lo que tiene un buen nivel de ventas ya que compra al por mayor en los mercados más importantes y de mayor afluencia de la ciudad. El crédito se invertirá en capital de trabajo para su tienda ya que por la enfermedad de su esposo no ha podido dedicarle mucho tiempo y está un poco desabastecida. Paulina trabaja con la institución desde hace bastante tiempo atrás, más específicamente desde el año 2004 y ahora está en su quinto crédito el cual lo cancela sin contratiempos. También tiene un crédito en otra institución bancaria el cual esta cancelando de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Paulina, 58, has recently become a widow due to her husband’s death by heart attack. She doesn’t have any little children depending of her any longer but the only child she still has lives with her in her own home. Paulina has had a small grocery store in her home for several years offering her products to her neighborhood. She doesn’t have any nearby competition so her sales are good because she stocks buying at wholesale from the most important and busiest markets in the city. She will use the funds to stock her store because her husband’s illness caused her to neglect her business a bit and it’s somewhat destabilized. Paulina has collaborated with the institution for quite some time now, specifically since 2004. This is her 5th loan which she will repay without any difficulty. She has an additional loan with another financial institution which she is also repaying punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anta Kourane

texts.fr: Anta Kourane M. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail et deux bœufs qu'elle engraissera et revendra au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta Kourane M. is a woman of 60 years that is married with 3 children. She has been a member of the Villagers Bank of Dankh Sene for 7 and a half years and has benefited from 15 loans that she has always regularly repaid. She is in the beef feeding trade and her new loan will allow her to buy livestock feed and two cows that she will fatten for around 4 to 5 months. She is helping to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of two cows to feed/fatten

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es Carpintero, tiene su propio taller ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con el que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su padre y su hijo de 10 años de edad viven con él  en la casa de su hermano ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Está separado de su esposa.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de madera y venesta como material para elaborar sus muebles y seguir trabajando.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para el préstamo solicitado por Ramiro.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a carpenter. He has a carpentry shop in the home where he lives. This is Ramiro's primary source of income to take care of his family. He lives in the city of La Paz in the house of his brother. Ramiro's 10 year old son, and Ramiro's father live there with him. Ramiro is currently separated from his wife. This loan will be used to purchase wood and varnish and other materials needed to continue his business. This is his first loan with Impro, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and varnish for his carpentry business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila K. is an entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business as a food vender in the Mbagala ward of Dar es Salaam. She sells different kinds of food, both fried and cooked, to customers. She purchases the business goods from the food shops in the city market center. She also sells some soft drinks, such as drinking water, soda and juices. 

She manages to meet her family's daily demands, including paying school fees, from the business income. She needs a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory to grow her clothing business

loans.name: Ngayma Dioulo

texts.fr: Ngayma Dioulo S. est âgée de 33ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DNAKH S. depuis 7 ans et demi et a eu 15 fois de suite l'expérience du crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de vêtement. Elle vend essentiellement des habits pour dames qu'elle achète dans les marchés pour revendre dans son village. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ngayma Dioulo S. is 33 years old, married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DNAKH S. for seven and a half years and has had 15 consecutive loans. She is developing a small clothing business. She mainly sells women's clothes which she buys in markets and resells in her village. Her profits allow her to help her husband to take care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.es:
Estelita tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, aun en edad escolar. Su domicilio queda ubicado en el distrito D. La Victoria, un distrito aledaño a la ciudad D. Chiclayo que cuenta con una considerable población.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la venta D. desayunos, jugos y extractos D. fruta en un mercado D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la idea del negocio surgió ante la necesidad D. obtener un ingreso adicional con el cual ayudar al sostenimiento familiar. Estelita atienD. su negocio durante todo el día y siempre trata D. ofrecer un buen servicio para mantener su negocio.

La calidad D. los alimentos que prepara ha hecho que su pequeño puesto D. venta D. comida tenga una acogida cada vez mas granD., por ese motivo ella desea implementar su negocio con la compra D. una licuadora y una waflera que le permitan ofrecer un buen servicio y captar mas clientes. Siguiendo su objetivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.

Estelita es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria para poder brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. estudiar alguna carrera superior. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Estelita, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two, school age children. Her address is in the La Victoria district, a populous district adjacent to the city of Chiclayo. She has sold breakfasts and fruit juices in one of Chiclayo’s markets for over 10 years. The idea for this business grew from the need to have an additional source of income with which to help support the family. Estelita tends to her business all day and always strives to offer good service in order to sustain her business. The quality of the meals she prepares has caused her small food stand to become gradually better-received. She needs to buy a blender and a waffle iron, therefore, to offer better service and attract more customers. With this objective in mind, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to request a 500 new sol loan. Estelita is a kind and very hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to grow as a businesswoman to proviD. her children with the opportunity to study an advanced career. She has collaborated with our institution previously and has shown herself to be a punctual and responsible client with regard to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a blender and a waffle iron.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné G. est âgée de 66 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE où elle a reçu successivement 15 prêts qu'elle toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail, un bœuf et de l'engraisser afin de le revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ngoné G. is 66 years old, married and mother to four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DANKH SENE for seven and a half years and has had 15 consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid on time. She has a beef fattening activity and her new loan will allow her to buy food for her livestock, as well as an ox to fatten up and resell after four to five months. Her profits allow her to help her husband take care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an ox for fattening

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Damaris del Socorro S. S., habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y  junto a su esposo procrearon 6 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son mayores y sobreviven de forma independiente, los otros 4 dependen económicamente de sus padres, el señor labora como guarda de seguridad y le apoya económicamente a los gastos del hogar a la señora S..

Ella realiza acarreos de las mercaderías de las tiendas del mercado oriental propiamente en el sector ferretero, tiene un equipo de personas que son las que llevan a cabo estos trabajos. En el diario vivir de la señora, en el Mercado Oriental, ha observado la necesidad de inaugurar una cafetería, que ofrezca los servicios de refresquería y comidas rápidas, esta ambición la tiene  a un futuro cercano, y para llevar a cabo esto, ella solicita de un préstamo que le ayude a elevar las ordenes de acarreo, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de una camioneta usada que le favorezca a incrementar los ingresos mensuales y así planificar la apertura de la cafetería, agradecería que se le apoyara, a mejorar día con día sus niveles económicos y tras esto la mejoría continua de sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro S. S. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She’s married and has 6 children, two of whom are adult and live independently and four that still depend on their parents. Her husband is a security guard and contributes to household expenses. She works hauling merchandise among the stalls in the Oriental market, specifically in the hardware section; she has a crew that work for her. In her daily experiences in the Oriental market she has noticed that there is a need to open a café that would offer fast food and refreshments. This is a goal for the near future. In order to accomplish this, she needs to increase her hauling orders so she is asking for funds to buy a used pick-up truck that would help her increase her monthly income so that she can plan to open her café. She would appreciate funding that would daily improve her income leading to subsequent improvement of living conditions for herself and her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pick-up truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de mèches, de tissages, des postiches, des perruques et renouveler ses outils de travail

loans.name: Griselda De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Griselda de la Cruz R., tiene 37 años y vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un taller torno, y ella labora como afanadora en un preescolar, ellos tienen tres jóvenes hijos. 

En el pasado tenían una pequeña venta de refrescos y comida, y se compraban materiales de uso personal y doméstico para vender, pero una mala administración, dio como resultado la quiebra inmediata de su fuente de ingresos, ahora ellos solicitan un préstamo para la apertura nuevamente de esta venta de comida y pulpería, ellos esperan se les brinde una nueva oportunidad para la llevar a andar este proyecto y así mejorar día a día sus condiciones de habitad y ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de un futuro más prospero.
texts.en:
Griselda de la Cruz R., 37, lives in Laureles Sur neighborhood; she’s married and her husband is a lathe operator. She is employed as a cleaning lady at a preschool; they have three young children. They used to have a small food and refreshment business where they also sold home and personal use items. However, poor administration led to the immediate failure of this source of income. They are asking for a new loan to reopen this food and grocery business. They hope that they will be given a new opportunity to succeed with this project so that their living conditions may improve and they can offer their children better prospects for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Margaret N. is a widow with three children. She works hard and strives hard for herself and for her family. She has single-handedly taken care of her family since five years ago, after the death of her husband. Also, she and her children were thrown out of her husband's house by the husband's family. This has been a big setback for her and her children. This hardship forced her embark into the trade of buying and reselling items like beans and palm oil.
 
The quest for business capital encouraged her to join GHAPE in 2007, and since then she has taken and repaid loans two times. She now needs a bigger amount of capital in order to expand her trading business. She knows the business will succeed because she has been doing this trade for a very long time and she has also learned marketing strategies from GHAPE, a Kiva partner. Also, her business will help the community buy from her nearby place rather than buying from afar, which increases cost.

With her profit, she is planning to expand her business, educate her children and she desires one day to buy a piece of land on which she can build her own house.  

Margaret’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and toward poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Beans, garri (fermented cassava tubers) and palm oil

loans.name: Ndèye Ndienda

texts.fr: NDèye Ndienda S. est une femme de 37 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH S. depuis 7 ans et demi, elle a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son prêt lui permettra de développer et de faire la promotion de son activité en achetant un bœuf à engraisser et revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Ndienda S. is a 37-year old lady who is married and mother to six children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DANKH S. for seven and a half years, has had 15 consecutive loans and has never had any problems with the repayments. She has a beef fattening activity.Her loan will allow her to develop and promote this activity buy buying an ox to fatten up and resell. Her profits allow her to contribute financially to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying oxen to fatten up

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Leonel de edad de 44 años, es padre de familia de tres hijos que junto con su esposa procrearon, los tres estudian, junto a su esposa trabajan en un negocio familiar, un comedor en el cual es el encargado de la caja chica como de hacer las compras para preparar los ricos platillos del comedor. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ahorro ha logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto, pero a un le falta embaldosar el piso que es de suelo, para una mejor higiene,  repellar las paredes, pintar. Con el préstamo lo que hará es embaldosar toda la casa para luego solo ponerle la cerámica. Para esto comprara: tierra para compactar, arena, cemento, piedrin. Ir poco a poco terminando lo de más. Con su crédito anterior logro hacer el muro en  la parte de atrás el cual esta contento por los beneficios que a través de estos financiamiento esta obteniendo.
texts.en:
Leone is a 44 year old family man. He and his wife have three children. All three of them go to school. He and his wife work together in a family business. It is a dining room. He is in charge of the small funds like making purchases in order to prepare the delicious dishes of their dining room. Thanks to their saving efforts, he has been able to build his house all of concrete. But, he still needs to tile one floor, which is a dirt floor. He needs to do this for better hygiene. He needs to plaster the walls and paint. With this loan he will tile the whole house, and later he will put in the ceramics. To do this he will buy land to compact, sand, cement, and gravel. He will finish the rest little by little. With his previous loan he built a wall in back of his house. He is pleased with the benefits he has gotten through the loans he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dirt to compact, sand, cement, and gravel to tile the floor in the house for better hygiene

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Born in 1964, Victorine K. was married and had four children, but she divorced her husband. She now lives with her six children. Her source of motivation is from the difficulties she faced, especially the death of her mother, poor health, her inability to continue her education and the destruction of her cassava farm by wildfire. This further compounded the situation and the consequences include an inability to educate her children, even in primary school.

Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers, she became a member of GHAPE and received her first loan of 40,000CFAF in 2007. Since then, she has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay loans up to the amount of 130,000CFAF. From previous loans she provided her community with shaa (locally produced drinks from corn). She is proud of her achievements, especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying her children’s school fees. 

Given a loan, she plans to continue in the same line of business. She provides drinks to the community and the business will succeed since people know her and usually call her “mami shaa.” Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and take care of her health and the family. 

Victorin’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and toward poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Corn, cups, jars and bottles

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Born in 1954, Theresia N. is a widow with five children. The fact that Theresia N. was a widow with the burden or inability to take care her children and to take care of their health actually motivated her to join GHAPE and she became very hardworking. She says her main aim of joining GHAPE was because of their educational talks and the training they offer before giving out loans. With a loan, she will be able to invest in buying more goats, feed and crop seeds for farming. She will generate more income, which will allow her to cater to her children’s education and their health. She also intend to open an account for herself to be saving her profit, which she will use for constructing a house for herself in the future. 

Theresi’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Goats and seedlings

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isabel P. G., tiene 40 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es madre soltera, de 3 hijos mayores que le ayudan a las tareas del hogar y su negocio.

Ella tiene una venta de comida típica nicaragüense, y dentro de sus necesidades más apremiantes esta la construcción de su vivienda, le ha ido muy bien en su negocio de venta de comida, tras varios problemas económico-sociales que la han agobiado, por que ha sido una mujer sola que dentro de  sus limitaciones económicas ha ofrecido a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias de vida,  ella ahora solicita de un préstamo para la reinversión a su negocio debido a que planea aumentar la producción, debido que ha observado un aumento en las ventas y planea abastecer esa oferta de trabajo para incrementar sus ingresos mensuales y poder proyectarse a la construcción de su hogar, para convidarle a sus hijos un hogar digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel P. G., age 40, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a single mother of three grown children. They help her with the household chores and her business. She sells typical Nicaraguan food. Among her more urgent needs is the construction of her house. She has been doing very well in her business of selling food after some socio-economic problems that have weighed her down. She is a woman alone who within her economic limitations has given her children the necessities of life. She is now asking for a loan to reinvest in her business. She plans to increase production because she has seen an increase in sales. She plans to stock up to increase her monthly earnings and be able to get into the construction of her house. She wants to give her children a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food and fixed assests to reinvest in her food stand
